Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: Great value when you're needing a get-away. Second time we've been here, couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “A Geat Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Irskay
Reviews.Content: A great find. More reasonable rates than the more popular hotels in Yountville, but with great accomodations. We stay at over 50 hotels every year. Room and bathroom luxurious and spacious. Two sinks, large shower and large tub. Bed extremely comfortable, with comforter, down pillows. Room with fireplace. Grounds and pool very appealing. S. & R. K, Encino, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but under heavy renovation which is interrupting”
Reviews.Author: SR22TSC
Reviews.Content: This is a very noisy place to stay which is not what you want in quiet quaint Yountville. The establIshment is highly effected by renovation with no compensation in rate and there is loud construction across the road. Wait till all this is completed !

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably noisy !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xyzcde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only next to a very busy main road it also has construction on 2 sides the noise level is unbearable avoid at all costs until all construuction is finished. You cannot escape the noise !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: micro1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a weekend visit to the wine country. A bit less expensive than some of the other places in the valley, but in Yountville nearly in the middle of everything. The property was undergoing some renovations, but other than a bit of a longer walk to breakfast, no problem for us. Room was large with fireplace (used "real" firelogs, but still sort of nice.) Very good hot breakfast included, and easy to park and get to room. Some of the best restaurants in the wine country close by in Yountville (walking distance) and overall a very nice stay. Easy 10 minute drive to Napa and/or Rutherford the other way. Plan to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Things get hot in the bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: lmooyman
Reviews.Content: Yes! There is a fireplace in your room! (not quite what you were thinking!). The room: spacious, well-appointed and romantic; the complimentary champagne breakfast: cloth napkins, champagne flutes, nice spread; the service: caring, professional and charming. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. Don't let the close proximity to a busy street worry you. We did not hear a sound from the road. The buildings are very well insulated....and don't forget to ask for extra Presto Logs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Lodge!!!!”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the Napa Valley Lodge for our 1 year anniversary, and it was worth the money and add to a perfect anniversary weekend. The staff was so friendly from the get go, I called to ask them to have Roses delivered and they had them ready the night we arrived. The brunch was great, lots of food and a waffle maker. A great brunch to put a nice base in your stomach before tasting some wines. The Lodge is walking distances to some great restaurants or a two minute drive to them. The fireplace and balcony were just an added plus. The rooms were very clean and I am extremely picky about my rooms cleanliness. All in all this place was great and I would highly recommend Napa Valley Lodge to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: SalesGirl77
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled up the coast from LA to Napa with the Napa Valley Inn as a destination mid week. This is a hotel I will come back to again and again. The room was huge, great balcony, awesome view of a vineyard, fantastic bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was unlike any other 'free' hotel breakfast, a real treat. The hot tub/ heated pool area was very welcoming and we spent several hours relaxing here. We booked a package with a king room and limo driven wine tour. If you intend to visit a few wineries during your stay this might be the best way to do it! When we return to Napa we will stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoquaciousColorado
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel. Clean room, nice breakfast and great staff. We arrived on a Friday and were able to experience the wine tasting (wonderful experience). The room was good. Only minor issues with the plus not holding chargers and the toilet running. The staff was great and very informative. I was a little taken back by the "spa." I guess I was expecting more (bigger/expansive) but the massage was great. A recommended hotel generally speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Waste of money. Room was smoky.”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheWorld4Peace
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. It is tremendously overpriced, the shower ran out of hot water, there was a strong smell of smoke in the room, the exercise room was tiny, the TV was not HD, and the breakfast was mediocre. This is the most expensive hotel I have ever stayed in, $393 a night including tax for a room for two, including breakfast. The room was OK, with a working fireplace and a fake log to burn. We did not use it, but when we returned from dinner there was a strong smell of wood smoke, probably leaking in from another room. Before dinner, I tried to take a shower. My wife had enough hot water when it was turned fully to hot, but for me, the hot water ran out. I called the desk, but they could not repair it immediately and we had to leave for a dinner reservation. When we got back, along with the smoke smell, there was a free bottle of wine, but this did not compensate to having to wash with a washcloth at the sink. We used the exercise room, advertised as â€œa well-equipped fitness room with the latest equipment.â€� It had only one treadmill, one bike, one step machine and one strange machine where you move your feet sideways. It was full and we could not do any exercise. The TV was flat screen, but not HD, and you could not change the aspect ratio. So everyone looked fat. The breakfast had terrible pastry, runny scrambled eggs, and a poor selection of fruit. I would have expected at such an expensive place something better. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight at Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: roaminrose
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at the Napa Valley Lodge when we had out-of-country guests visiting. I was able to get a package deal that included a fireplace king room, a complimentary bottle of wine, and "complimentary wine tasting passes" for about $160/room. I think this is because we went in winter. My first impression of the Lodge was a bit ho-hum from the outside. It is right off highway 29 (but we learned that the rooms have great soundproofing and we certainly didn't notice cars, it is a very small highway). When we walked into the lobby to check in, I was impressed with the warmth of the lobby and sitting room. A fire was roaring in the fireplace, and there is always coffee and tea set out for guests. My only disappointment with the check-in process was that the "complimentary wine tasting passes" were actually all 2-for-1 wine tasting passes so we would have to pay $10-$15/winery for each couple's tasting. This is not quite what was advertised and my only real complaint with the entire stay. The rooms were lovely, very clean, modern, and tasteful. They include a duraflame log in each fireplace and a nice coffee/tea set-up in the room. Toiletries are very nice too, great smelling! The robes and slippers are a nice touch. The pool and jacuzzi are lovely, sort of Tuscan style with nice towels provided. I imagine that lounging at the poolside would be wonderful on a warm day. The only critique I would offer is that, the second day, I got up at 9 to go for a swim. Even though this was within the hours of operation for the pool, when I got down there, the pool was being cleaned and equipment was just left hanging out in the pool. The person maintaining the pool came back and noticed me swimming around the equipment and very nicely offered to come back later. It just seemed like imperfect planning on the hotel's part. Again, a very small complaint. We very much enjoyed the complimentary champagne brunch--nice food and good quality sparkling wine, coffees, juices. Very tasty and a nice touch to offer it free of charge. The Lodge is very close to the restaurants, wine bars, and shops of Yountville, just a 5-10 minute walk to most. It is also a short drive to lots of great wineries! I recommend Goosecross Cellars as a lovely winery to visit in the local area. All in all, I would definitely stay at the Napa Valley Lodge in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl30_11
Reviews.Content: This place is a GEM!!!! Nothing beats being able to walk off your patio into a vineyard with a glass of wine in your hand. The service was excellent. Very nice, friendly staff. The room and view were stunning! Very luxurious large bathroom, with nice bath robes. I was also very impressed that there was a mini Keriug machine in our room. The bed was very comfortable and the fire place was a perfect touch nestled in the corner of the room. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Balazy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Napa Valley lodge and had a nice time. She enjoyed the substantial breakfast and I enjoyed the cookies and wine tastings at the property. We got a good deal from Travelzoo. Not sure how I would feel about paying high peak season rates as the value from the property is more location-based than luxury based. Although in Yountville, it is a bit of a walk to the famous restaurants (other side of town). The hotel was a perfectly nice and reasonable place to stay as a good base for wine country touring.

Reviews.Title: “Good got better”
Reviews.Author: rcorrao
Reviews.Content: We visited the Napa Valley Lodge over president's day weekend, to find that booking through priceline doesn't really get what you want. While priceline confirmed a king room, we had two double beds. The management team was overly accommodating, while they couldn't help us the first night, they made it up the next by not only getting us into a king room but also upgrading our room. The standard double room was in fact a little tired/dated, while the upgraded room/suite was very nice. I'd recommend (and will do the same next time) just springing for the suite if you can get it. The breakfast is included - and it does have hot items. It seemed adequate...but nothing to send me home to blog about... except the coffee. I'm a coffee lover, and there is nothing to love about the coffee at the hotel...so grab breakfast, and take a walk in beautiful Yountville to one of the many nearby coffee shops. All in the service and fantastic staff have me give this place a "Very Good"

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra W
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe king room with fireplace on the lower level facing the vineyard. Â The room was large and spacious as well as the bath area. Â There was no tub but the shower was roomy and there were ample toiletries. Â  We thoroughly enjoyed our champagne breakfasts each morning in the breakfast lounge by the fire. There is some construction going on during the day but it did not interfere with our enjoyment. Â While the beds are not uncomfortable I didn't find them as luxurious as some. Â The rooms have flat screens but didn't seem to receive any high def. Â We would definitely return but I would recommend a room on the upper level to avoid the noise coming from the room above.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Grandpoobah918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here in 2011 and were thrilled to go back last week. The desk personnel and the housekeeping staff are top notch and we did not want for anything. Our room faced the tranquil vineyard surrounding the property and it was quiet and peaceful. I wanted to take the bed home with me...but could not figure out a way to get it into the trunk of the car! An added bonus for me...as I am a chocoholic, were the chocolate chip cookies available every afternoon! All on all...a very enjoyable experience and one that I hope will be repeated soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kati M
Reviews.Content: Nice place in a great location. Staff was very nice and helpful. Got a great deal thru Travel Zoo. Perfect robes and slippers are in the room for guest use (can purchase also). Used ours to go to the hot tub. Hot tub/pool area is very relaxing. Fire pit was going so we took advantage of a little more relaxation. Complimentary champagne breakfast has it all. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sonja D
Reviews.Content: Napa Valley Lodge knows the true meaning of hospitality and customer service. My husband and I celebrated our 25th Anniversary in Napa Valley. Everything was perfect. Napa Valley Lodge consists of extremely comfortable rooms with all of the first class amenities. Scenic views with quiet surroundings all within walking distance of the finest restaurants in the surrounding Napa Valley. Perfect from the very first friendly phone call. We can't wait to visit Napa Valley Lodge in the future. Thank you Joanne for making our special occasion an anniversary to remember and cherish forever. <3 Mr.and Mrs. Derkits

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay While in Napa”
Reviews.Author: plants1432
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Napa to wine taste for several years and we stay at the Napa Valley Lodge in Yountville every year. The accomadations are great and the staff is very friendly. Each morning you will be treated to a complimentary breakfast that is more than coffee and a danish. Another plus is the location, which is about halfway between Napa and St.Helens on Hwy. 29. Napa Valley Lodge also emails you with lodging specials and we were even upgraded to a suite when they found out about our anniversary. Their pool and evening fire pit are also other extras that have made our stay enjoyable. They are centrally located among all of the wineries. DLP

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy G
Reviews.Content: The Monterey Plaza has been one of our favorite hotels for years but we might have to re-think that after staying at the Napa Valley Lodge. We love Napa and the location here is perfect with many great restaurants and wine tasting rooms within walking distance. We arrived early and were a little disappointed that we could not get in our room until 4 but there were a lot of things to do close by. Our room was very nice with a huge fireplace and cute balcony overlooking the courtyard and pool. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was our 40th anniversery and they even had a nice card and a bottle of wine waiting for us in our room. Breakfast champagn buffet was an added surprise the next morning. Everything was delicious. They had arranged a VIP wine tasting for us and it was very nice. We would definetly recommend the Lodge to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly luxury!”
Reviews.Author: cocoloco07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napa Valley Lodge when Villagio Inn in Yountville where we normally stay was fully booked for a spacial event on the weekend of our trip to Napa. The property is located on a busy intersection (if there can be such a thing in Napa, but in this case there actually is), and the lodging was so close to the main road that we heard traffic noises early in the morning. We arrived a couple of hours before check in time, so we were unable to check into our room right away, so decided to wait at the swimming pool which I found to be somewhat ordinary for a spa resort. My husband and I had to take turns walking back to the reception to ask if the room was ready, and despite the fact there were no other cars (everyone was possibly out wine tasting?) and the premise seemed very quiet, they told us the room was still not ready past the normal check in time. But what bothered us more than the delayed check in was the attitude of the woman at the reception who seemed in the least bit apologetic. The room itself is nicely decorated and was equipped with nice amenities. There was, however, no bathtub in our room. As for the poolside spa, my husband and I were shocked at the small size of the room where we got the couple massage. There was barely any room for the two masseuse to move around, and because the room is a free standing structure at the corner of the pool deck with hardly any soundproofing, we could clearly hear the guests at the pool side talking, and some kind of construction noise even over the "spa" music the masseuse played on their cd player. Not what I would consider relaxing. Finally, the breakfast that is included in the rate was served in what looked like a partitioned meeting room. There were selection of food I would expect at a second rate business hotel, and definitely not at a first class spa resort hotel. All in all, we're sticking with Villagio Inn. And if we can't book a room there for what ever reason, we're going to just make a day trip!

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Property”
Reviews.Author: SiMac2012
Reviews.Content: While we enjoy all of the Woodside Hotel properties - we have found our new favorite getaway place amongst them. Location, location, location.... the property is conveniently located and accessible to some of the best restaurants and wineries in the world. All within walking distance!!! But, that is if you decide to leave the property. From the minute we pulled in we were greeted by a professional, courteous and knowledgeable staff that actually made us feel that they sincerely cared about our time staying with them. The room was very nicely appointed with a very modern and spacious bathroom (huge stone shower), fireplace and a very usable balcony... not just the little one that barely holds 2 chairs. The entire property is very nicely landscaped - even in the middle of winter. The main courtyard had a pool, hot tub and lounge area with fire pits. And let's not forget the Bocce Ball court!! I wish that we were there when it was a bit warmer because we definitely would have taken a bottle of wine to the pool area and soaked up some sun. We definitely will be back and will hopefully be bringing friends along with us.

Reviews.Title: “winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: tamara w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Napa Lodge and had a great time. They are offering a great winter getaway package until the end of February. We stayed in a king room with a wood burning fireplace. We had views of the courtyard. We enjoyed all of the amenities- bocci, spa, pool, fitness center, firepit, massage, and delicious buffet breakfast. The staff is helpful and friendly, rooms clean and good size. I loved the location too. We rented bikes across the street and had dinner in town at Bistro Jainty- awesome french food. I have been recommending this hotel to everyone and will definately stay in a woodside hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but doesn't offer the "wine country" experience you'd hope for”
Reviews.Author: kmh200886
Reviews.Content: For those traveling to Napa, I imagine the hope is for a spacious and light room, with clean country breezes, with views of rolling vineyards, and only the sounds of birds chirping. If that is what you are looking for, do not book NVL. NVL lodge is an adequate base from which to explore, located adjacent to the highway and close to all the shops and restaurants in Yountville. But there is nothing really extraordinary about it, and the rooms were dimly lit and a bit dated (bathrooms were nice). There's just nothing magical about it - we booked only because it was absolutely the only thing available for a last-minute trip. NVL is not particularly bad, but just average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ccs1990
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with attention to detail. Great amenities and location was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Lodge = Average”
Reviews.Author: pwnguy1j
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews about the Napa Valley Lodge, I was really hoping for an amazing experience. Unfortunately, all I can give it is 3.5 out of 5 stars. First the good things: location is idea within the Napa Valley. Close to the highway which provided easy access. It is also within walking distance of the main part of town. This makes it helpful when you are wine tasting...no driving! The champagne brunch is also great! Many choices on the menu. The down side - While I have heard many great things about the staff at the lodge, I can only state that the folks at the front desk were not entirely welcoming. They were efficient with getting our room but was not familiar with the events going on in the valley (January is Restaurant month in Napa and they didn't know anything about it). My partner and I felt that they were a bit cold to us. This was reinforced when I called down to the front desk for a question and they were short and to the point. The facility is OK but nothing worth the "four stars" that others have given. The rooms have been remodeled but it felt like a motel that was fixed up to attract the Napa tourists. We stayed at the lodge since Travelzoo offered a special. I would have been upset if I had paid full price and had the same experience. For one night...the place was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to relax”
Reviews.Author: CANDVD
Reviews.Content: Napa Valley Lodge is awesome. The rooms are pretty nice, a little noise from other suites and/or the front door, but nothing too bad. The breakfast each morning is actually quite fantastic to be included with a room - especially because you can eat it outside next to the vineyard. (Food quality and selection is pretty good - I've often paid $20-30 at a big hotel for way worse selection and quality.) The pool is also fantastic - with either beverage service (limited options) or bring it yourself. Something we wish we knew ahead of time is to bring your own wine - they even provide you an ice bucket to keep the white cold (that's what we did our second afternoon/early evening). The lodge also organizes local wineries to come and offer tastings in the lobby - take advantage of this! The location of this lodge is awesome. Close to the highway, walking distance to Yountville's restaurants, and access to the trails for biking. We look forward to returning - a great choice no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very nice king room with fireplace. The hotel was very well located with Yountville's restaurants in walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful, service was very good. The whirlpool was particularly nice in chilly January. We had a wonderful and very relaxing stay there and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Returning to the Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Dan O
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Napa Valley Lodge for over twenty years, but after the recent major renovations, it was like visiting another hotel. Both the interior decorations and the room arrangement have improved in a major way and the redesigned bathrooms were especially impressive. The next day, I noticed that the breakfast offered had definitely kept pace with the other establishments in Yountville. All in all, this was a superior experience on all levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frank R
Reviews.Content: A perfectly situated location. Very nice room with fireplace. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: betsy w
Reviews.Content: Great stay, very relaxing! Excellent hotel and friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay, nice spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: BTKuah
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant enough stay at the Napa Valley Lodge and found the rooms to be spacious and comfortable. The location near the expressway makes it easy for us to go off to explore Yountville and also St Helena. The staff were helpful but we had a little problem when trying to book a spa treatment. There weren't enough therapists and though Front desk offered to make a booking at the Villagio Inn and Spa, that didn't work out too well because the Front desk had mistakenly informed us that Villagio would accept my teenaged kids so long as I gave a permission slip. Only when we got to the Villagio that afternoon did we find out that the spa could not accommodate anyone under 18 years even with parental permission. The Napa Valley Lodge front desk had apparently left a voice message on my room phone but as we were out we never got the message. Other than this little hiccup, we had no complaints about this place. It is really very well located and convenient and the rooms very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, very relaxing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GB93465
Reviews.Content: We spent two very relaxing nights at the Napa Valley Lodge! The room was very comfortable, clean and spacious. The complimentary breakfast was HUGE and quite good! We also spent a nice evening drinking wine around the outdoor fireplace - very romantic. The pool is lovely as well. Would for sure recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Worth an autumn stay”
Reviews.Author: thrall
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice 4-day Thanksgiving holiday in Yountville and found the Napa Valley Lodge to be a pleasant property. It was comfortable, clean and well-situated. We loved the walk-in shower, the spacious room, and the view over the little vineyard whose leaves had turned fall colors. Other pros include free wi-fi, parking, and a maximum walk of about a mile to the other end of town (the NVL is on the far northern end). As complimentary hotel buffet breakfasts go, theirs was pretty good with sparkling wine, fruit, cheese, eggs, waffles, and sausage gravy (though when there are no biscuits, why bother?). Large groups with kids made it difficult to get a table at breakfast and impossible to use the waffle iron. If you can book in the off season, the rates are fair, but I'm not sure the rate would have been worthwhile during peak times. There was no in-room safe, and traffic noise was a problem for the rooms about 300 feet from Hwy 29. We received good advice and services from one staffer, but another was generally nice but unhelpful. Being in the back building feels like a motel as you troop through the parking lot for everything. The property is nice but not extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Emily L
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge, on a cozy, quiet Sunday right before Christmas. The hotel seemed happy to have us, as the weekend was slowing down, but they had the same enthusiasm as though the hotel was packed to the gill as it had been the night before. As we were waiting for our room to be ready the front desk recommended we go tour the Mondavi vineyards, which was a perfect suggestion, and then as we were driving back our room was ready! We picked up our wine passes, Hope and Grace and Cornerstone were fantastic recommendations! Once we checked into our room, everything was just right. We lit a fire, and poured our complimentary bottle of wine, and got engaged! Thats how magical this place felt. Looking out our porch, over the vineyard, in front of the fireplace, Scott (my fiance) decided this was the perfect place to ask me to marry him. To celebrate we dove in the pool, warmed up in the hottub and wandered upstairs in the comfy robes provided in our beautiful bathroom. Just a little bit of a walk away from Bistro Jeanty we strolled down the street to have an INCREDIBLE dinner. For anyone looking for a romantic weekend getaway, the Napa Valley Lodge is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: blunchli
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stopover at Napa and booked a room at this place through Expedia. We saw some fairly good ratings / reviews online and after being to this place I must say this exceeded our usual expectations from small hotel in a small town. The room was very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful. The lady at the reception gave me details on various wineries and also coupons that I could use at various restaurants. The hotel is close to the Napa downtown restaurants. Overall for its price, it is a great place to stay.. clean, comfortable, friendly and easily accessible. I would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little gem in Napa”
Reviews.Author: shannonziggy
Reviews.Content: This place is so adorable, our room was great with a balcony and a fireplace. It's a perfect location, within walking distance to the tasting rooms and restaurants in Yountville. There is a charming courtyard with a hot tub, fountains, bocce ball court, etc... It's also perfectly located in the heart of the valley, i would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Boschen36897
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at this impeccably well serviced hotel. We loved the fact that it was in walking distance to the Yountville restaurants and shops. We also took several breaks during the day to rejuvenate by enjoying the pool and outdoor fire pit. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge and our experience was Fantastic! There was a complimentary bottle of Merlot in our Cabrernet Suite. The suite was beautifully laid out and it was spacious. Most importantly, the room provided the much needed peace and quite I sorely needed (I was home from RR from Kandahar, Afghanistan). The front desk was extremely helpful. No matter how many questions my wife and I asked, the front desk ALWAYS assisted us with a cheerful smile --YESSSS!!!! So, would I stay at the Napa Valley Lodge again? Yes. In fact, my wife and I are discussing timetables for our next visit. Would I recommend the Napa Valley Lodge to friends, family and others? Yes, yes, and yes. Lastly, I thank Mark Stohlman and his team for providing me and my wife a wonderful weekend getaway experience. Steve Wilson Please email if you have specific questions: Steve.2472@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “lovely setting, great service”
Reviews.Author: ElayneLosGatos
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the advantage of being walking distance to Yountville restaurants, yet having a peaceful view of the vineyards outside town. My daughter and I have made this a mother-daughter trip twiceâ€”once when she was admitted to Veterinary School and recently, when she took the Veterinary Medicine National Boards. Both times we had a lovely, celebratory trip together. The rooms are large and the fireplace comfey. We were grateful that the managers were very understanding and allowed us a last-minute change in our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp for Napa weekend”
Reviews.Author: jason m
Reviews.Content: Lucky enough to secure lunch reservations at the French Laundry and needed a place to stay within walking distance. Napa Valley Lodge is close enough to that and the other restaurants / shops in town, but far enough away that it was a nice walk after an epic meal. Comfortable rooms with a fireplace ready to be lit, bocci ball court!, and a pool / hot tub. Only thing that wasn't great was that the hot tub was way too chlorinated leaving a bunch of us with itching / irritated skin and a strong chemical smell on our hands which wasn't great when wine tasting. But I assume that was a one time error - it was really a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherry j
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely two days at the Napa Valley Lodge. The room was lovely and spacious, the staff could not have been friendlier. Very charming, intimate "villa" feel to the building and grounds.

Reviews.Title: “A glorified motel”
Reviews.Author: Jmaksik
Reviews.Content: Although the Napa Valley Lodge is nicely run, it is no more than a nice motel. The rooms are decent and clean, though dark and the walls are thin, as are the towels. Breakfast, which is included in the overpriced rates, is adequate. The public area around the pool has a firepit and some effort has gone into making it accommodating, but it is also just off the highway. In short, it's all just ok. A "lodge" it certainly isn't, though the management does what it can to make things a bit better. Short of tearing the place down, there isn't much more they can do.

Reviews.Title: “Most quaint friendly and beautiful hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: StephanieJoplin
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. First of all we were upgraded after a long painful day of air travel, and we're greeted by the most delicious selection of cheeses and fruits upon arrival in our room. The continental breakfast is amazing!!! Hot and cold selections and the best cinnamon rolls ever. Maid service is courteous and impeccable. Fireplace in our room was simply fabulous and romantic- wonderful amenities and centrally located. Can't ask for better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Special”
Reviews.Author: Kristin P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 2nd wedding anniversary and the staff of the Napa Valley Lodge did everything they could to make it special. When we checked in, immediately a complimentary bottle of wine was brought to our room. We had plenty of logs for the fire, and our room was upgraded because of our special occasion. We had a beautiful view of the courtyard with the pool, bocce courts, and fire pit. The bathroom in our suite was to die for, and everything was immaculately clean. The breakfast served in the morning was above and beyond anything we expected. We will definitely be staying here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Barbarabliss
Reviews.Content: Clean, excellent location, spa service great, champagne breakfast very good. Rates high.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, centrally located, surprising options for a champagne breakfast, but what makes it great is the staff. Start with JoAnne who couldn't have been more helpful assisting us in making reservations for the hotel, winery tours, dinners, and a driver she recommended who outperformed our expectations. And then the staff who provided us dinnerware for our outdoor dinner in the courtyard by the firepit and pool. Within walking distance to some great restaurants. Hotel was clean, comfortable, grounds are extremely well landscaped and manicured. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “convenient deluxe "motel"”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerfrance
Reviews.Content: I would not call it anything else as a "deluxe motel "with well sized comfortable rooms but no welcoming or homy feeling at all.. nevertheless it is conveniently located in the Napa Valley for visiting the nice towns and wineries.It is no secret that most hotels in the Napa are overpriced and insist on minimum stays...As also the Napa valley Lodge was a bid overpriced in comparison with its service offered,,,

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: SkyTraveller72
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a centralised location for wine tasting and near some great restaurants. Our room was lovely and spacious and the Champagne breakfast was great. The hotel grounds are well maintained, with a lovely pool and beautiful fire pit seating area. The staff were extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful. I can't recommend this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy C
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. Staff is warm, friendly and very helpful. The location is great, just a 10 min walk to Yountville. Rooms are nice and spacious with balconies that overlook the beautiful pool, firepit & backyard area. Compared to the other hotels, their prices are very reasonable for that area. We plan to return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Deb0811
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay (Girls Trip) at the Napa Valley Lodge during the past two years. We love the location due to the number of wonderful restaurants, wineries and shops that are located within walking distance. The rooms are good sized and the bathrooms are newly renovated and spacious. We also thoroughly enjoy the delicious breakfast and mimosa each morning before heading out for the day. We definitely plan to stay at the Napa Valley Lodge again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “liked”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: we took this hotel mainly because bike rental was just infront and we were willing to bike one of the many trails available we exercise like crazy and had a lot of fun around even the property from the outside says nothing i love everything ,parking in front of the room,very big room and bath ,traditional but also contemporary decor,nice pool to relax and good country style breakfast this hotel helps to the perfect memories i have of napa i assume everybody drives if not make no sence staying here because yountville its a ver small town ,few good restaurants and that is all we drove almost every day to napa were there are more options and retaurants

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at how nice the entire hotel was. Spacious rooms, beautiful pool area, great location. We were trying not to spend too much money per night so we thought we might be compromising a bit but the Napa Valley Lodge exceeded our expectations. Would definitely go back and/or recommend it to others. And the complimentary breakfast was great; fresh food, good variety, not just a few pastries thrown on a table.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent”
Reviews.Author: calendergirl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for touring around the Napa Valley area. It is quite close to a busy road but this was not a negative. Our room over looked the Vineyard. The Lodge is within walking distance to some wonderful restaurants. There is no Bar or restaurant at the Lodge.The ladies on reception where very helpful and informative. The only negative really was breakfast. It was served in a communal environment. The coffee was cold on both mornings even though many guests complained, it still remained cold! Its very expensive but thee again everything in Napa is....

Reviews.Title: “the vacation of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Pat C
Reviews.Content: This property was recommended by a friend who had been to Napa Valley. Before we arrived, I was extremely impressed with the assistance from the concierge in making reservations at restaurants and wineries. She was a charming young lady & great at taking care of details. The property is lovely and charming. A delightful change from chain hotels. Our room was quiet, spacious, attractive, with a small private patio anchored by a peaceful water fountain and a view past white rose bushes into a vineyard. The location was perfect, convenient to world-class restaurants and hundreds of wineries. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Special People”
Reviews.Author: Howard H
Reviews.Content: The room my wife and I enjoyed was very spacious and gracious. I loved the fact that there was a mini-library surrounding the fire place. I even picked up a Joseph Heller book i hadn't read. But the stay is all about feeling like you're being greeted by family. And that's the way we felt. THe staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. Also, the complimentary breakfast was a notch above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gate95
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms, for my wife and me, plus my in-laws. We booked three nights, at rack rate (430$ plus each night for each room). Pros: nice location in Yountville. Close to restaurants. Excellent concierge, helped make two great dinner reservations. Very friendly desk. Cons: As other commentators have said, the hotel is really a motel. A good description would be a La Quinta on steroids: similar feel and style, slightly more upscale furnishings. We had three problems: 1) Route 29, right outside the window. This is the main highway through Napa, and 18 wheelers run up and down all night. Not very relaxing 2) It was impossible to mask the road noise using the air conditioner. Regardless of the fan settings, the fan clicks on and off all night (if it doesn't sense movement, I think). 3) We got placed in a room (#48) with a thinly insulated connecting door, next to a bridal party on the night before the wedding. We were awoken several times during the night by screaming women, and then again at 6am as the bride got ready for the big day. The final insult was the cancellation policy: We were called back home a day early so that my wife could perform an emergency surgery. The hotel claims that there is a 7 day cancellation policy, and refused to credit the third night for our room. They offered to resell it, but said that there were 14 unsold rooms that needed to be sold first. So no refund of the third night. My point: if there were 14 unsold rooms, our leaving early obviously didn't deprive anyone of a room. I spend a LOT of time in hotels, and all in all, I don't think that we've ever paid $2400 ($400 for each rom, times two rooms times three nights...) and received such poor value or lack of concern/ respect from management. Not refunding a third unused night in a fairly empty hotel was the final insult. What shabby treatment of generally easy to please customers.

Reviews.Title: “A centrally located, lovely gem in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: jeannemac
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading Tripadvisor reviews, and, as usual, I'm glad I did. My friend and I checked in on a Tuesday afternoon and liked it so much we stayed two extra nights. Following posted tips, we asked for a room overlooking the pool area. I highly recommend specifying that request. As promised, this property is in a perfect location to serve as a base for all Napa adventures, be they north, south or east across the narrow valley to find the Silverado Trail. Yountville, itself is a little paradise for lovers of wonderful food and celebrity chefs. At Napa Valley Lodge, great attention has been paid to landscaping and to care for the pool and fountains and grounds. The rooms are up to date, clean, spacious and comfortable. We enjoyed coffee on our own balcony every morning. Breakfast exceeded its "continental" claim with a sumptuous spread of juices, champagne, scrambled eggs, sausage, gravy, cold cuts, cheeses, sliced fruit, and pastries, in addition to the healthy choices generally found in one's own kitchen. From start to finish, the lodge staff helped make our stay enjoyable. With ease, they directed us to unique wineries, spas and fine dining. We would not have made it to the Hess Collection of contemporary art, to the awesome views from Artesa, to Michael Chiorello's Ristorante Bottega, or to Bouchon without their encouragement. (By the way, our most memorable meals were at Bottega in Yountville and dear old Mustards on Highway 29.) As we checked out, we suggested to staff that the pool temp could be a wee bit higher. They were paying attention, and my guess is that an immediate adjustment was made. The spa, of course, was toasty. This was a perfect place to launch and recover from three days of ardent exploration and self indulgence. True, it is a bit close to the main highway, but that is an invisible feature that can almost be totally ignored.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: Francesjr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Room was large, comfortable, and breakfast was excellent. Loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice”
Reviews.Author: allisonsc
Reviews.Content: I found it difficult to choose a hotel for our stay in Napa. This was a nice choice. The town of Yountville is small and not over crowded. Big, gorgeous bathroom with an updated walk in tile shower and granite vanity. Comfortable bed, spacious room with fireplace, and a nice setting. Breakfast was good - not gourmet but not continental either. Helpful staff. Careful - there is a 7 day cancellation policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Beautiful Spot”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer1952
Reviews.Content: My wife, 16 year old daughter and I had a very nice two night stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. The lodge is designed as a Mediterranean country villa (Italian? or Spanish so let's say California Med.) The large room was well appointed overlooking the courtyard which includes the pool, hot tub, fire pit and bocce court all set in a lovely garden. (Some rooms have fireplaces.) Breakfast is served in a separate room off the courtyard and spa. Quite reasonable food selection. However it is hard to resist walking the five minutes to Bouchon Bakery just up the street. Perhaps one of the finest bakeries in the US. Have the almond croissant and you can die a happy person. Yountville is a great place from which to tour Napa and Sonoma. Charming village, outstanding restaurants (make reservations ahead) and a great central location with many of the major wineries just a short distance away. Napa Valley Lodge is a great choice, attractive, well appointed comfortable beds, very pleasant staff, We would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit...still loving it !”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: Had to wait for our room till 4PM, but that's was okay, hung out at the pool area, made us relax. The rooms are very nice, the one maintenance man, filled the fountain outside our patio with water, it was so nice to leave the doors open to the patio, and listen to the water all night. Always seem to have something special done for us, when we are there. An excellant staff, very friendly, and caring. This was, the third stay at the Napa Valley Lodge, for my wife and I, and we'll be back, perfect location to all the wineries. Can't say enough about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: WesternCRNA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were only here for one night, but it doesn't take long to realize that the Napa Valley Lodge is all about comfort and relaxation. We visited the pool and hot-tub area which was very nice and had a dedicated server to bring beer, wine, & cheese platters. There is a complimentary breakfast, but we did not get to enjoy it because we left early for a hot-air balloon ride. The staff was friendly and courteous. The rooms were well appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wine country location!”
Reviews.Author: Hudsonmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for our 5 year anniversary on the recommendation of our travel agent. She couldn't have picked a better location for our stay. The room was perfect overlooking a small vineyard. Yes...as in other reviews, you can see the highway but we were never bothered by noise. The pool area is fabulous for relaxing and enjoying a glass of wine by the fire. The champagne breakfast each morning was a great way to start the day. The hotel is in walking distance to all the best restaurants. (Definitely check out Bottega and Ad Hoc! You won't be disappointed!). Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a nice wine county getaway without the boutiquey style of some of the other local hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: MiasMomma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for 3 nights over the Labor Day Weekend. The property was well located near the downtown Yountville area (we walked to the town during the day and drove at night because it was chilly and I was in heels). Our room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was yummy and the pool/jacuzzi/fire pit were wonderful! My only two complaints, which were not too big a deal were: the pillows were totally uncomfortable and we could here every little sound that was going on in the room above us. The walls were paper thin! Otherwise, great relaxing vacation and I would absolutely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Napa Valley at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: freefie
Reviews.Content: Yountville is the quintessential Napa Valley, complete with a romantic-level of quaint, Michelen-rated dining experiences, and countless wineries that produce some of the world's best wines. The Napa Valley Lodge is the perfect place to call "home base" in the middle of it all. The rooms are comfortably appointed, though I found the mattress a bit soft for my weary back, and well-stocked with mini-bar snacks and a complimentary bottle of wine (ours was a bottle of Domaine Chandon champagne, whose namesake winery is just up the road a mile or so). The grounds are well-kept and though the hotel is located on the corner of the highway that runs through the Valley, the walls surrounding the property are high enough to block out the highway view, leaving us with a splendid view of the surrounding mountains. In addition, strategically-placed fountains around the perimeter of the property mask any residual traffic noise. On our short, three-night trip, we visited 5 wineries and tasting rooms around Napa and Sonoma, took in the sights around downtown Yountville (including waiting at Bouchon Bakery for savory monkey bread), lunched at the French Laundry (only two blocks from the Napa Valley Lodge), and dined at Etoile at Domaine Chandon. It was the perfect location at an incredibly reasonable price, particularly compared to other hotel properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: JL81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NPL for 2 nights in early August and were quite happy with our stay. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. The pool area is modern and very nice. Breakfast was excellent. It is well located, within short walking distance to several of the most popular fancy restaurants in Yountville. The only downside to NPL is cost. If this hotel were located almost anywhere else, its prices would be closer to $200 rather than $300. You pay a lot for what you get, but that's par for the course in Napa Valley. With that in mind, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor.com we ended up changing our reservation at another hotel to stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. Yes, Napa is an expensive place to visit but we felt that this hotel gave us the feeling of luxury at an affordable price. Napa was one of our last stops on our California road trip and when we walked in to our room, it was the feeling of "Ahhh" ... clean, spacious and a view of the pool, courtyard and vineyard (and yes, the road, but it was still lovely). The pool and rooms were as nice as they looked on the NVL website (which is not always the case, as we discovered at other hotels). The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom well laid out and the service was great. If you're heading to Napa and you love great food and wine, Yountville is the place to stay as the choice of many top restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel. We ate at Ad Hoc and Bottega and both were fabulous meals. All in all, an excellent choice and we appreciate all the reviews that helped us pick it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mishuggina
Reviews.Content: We wound up staying at the NVL pretty much because it was the only decent hotel in the Yountville area that wasn't already book, and we were so happy we lucked into this. The hotel had huge rooms and showers, a huge pool with plenty of places to lay out (including beds) next to it. Nice bubbly hot tub, fire pit, and bocce ball (which we didn't get around to playing). Staff was extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful. When we decided at the last minute to do car service for the day for winery tours they had it arranged in no time. Next time I'll be looking for them first instead of by luck!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Yountville and the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: ellasacramento
Reviews.Content: A group of ladies celebrating a birthday stayed two nights. Rooms were very nice, clean and recently updated. We found the staff very friendly and helpfull. Spent time at the pool, enjoyed our blueberry margaritas! Breakfast was beyond what we expected, even had bisquits and gravy! This hotel is very convienent to walking into Yountville to have dinner and a perfect location for visiting the Napa Valley. Will defintely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Large Rooms, but a little overpriced...”
Reviews.Author: sumarielu
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge was very well situated. I loved Yountville. It is great to be able to walk to Bouchon Bakery in the morning and have coffee and a dreamy chocolate almond croissant. The rooms were very nice, large and clean. The beds were super comfortable. The grounds were nice, but I just didn't think there was enough here to justify the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jellybean12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights during the summer. The room and bathroom were beautiful: Decorations were lovely and relaxing. We used a fireplace log each night (the nights are cool here.) The pool area is also attractive and inviting. Free breakfast with champaign was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: TravelbumSouthUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was within walking distance of the French Laundry and we could use it as a base for wine tasting. The hotel is very nice, not super high end but still had everything you needed and was decently priced. The pool, bocce and jacuzzi area is a real plus. There are also fire pits to lounge around with a glass of wine before heading out to dinner. It is great to be within walking distance of all the restaurants and shops, there are even several place to wine taste within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: mamachef7
Reviews.Content: I won a stay at this hotel from the Rachael Ray show grilling contest. It was an amazing experience all around. The room was so spacious (standard room no-less) with a balcony and huge bathroom. Nothing like any hotel bathroom I have seen. Different areas for shower vanity and sink which makes it convenient. I even "downgraded" my luxury room so I could stay 5 nights instead of 3 since we only use the room to sleep & shower anyway. I wouldn't have even noticed the difference. The standard room was so luxurious as well. The beds were super comfortable and there was plenty of drawer & closet space. The champagne breakfast was great. There was something for everyone including my son who ate waffles everyday! The pastries were tasty, not the typical plastic wrapped kind you get at other hotels. Overall, a very relaxing atmosphere with beautiful pool, jacuzzi and fire pit area. great place to relax with a bottle of wine at night. Just wished the pool area closed a little later...The hotel is located conveniently to the wineries and other kid friendly activities. There is also a nice downtown area within walking distance with great restaurants...we ate at the child friendly Pacific Blues which had a relaxed atmosphere & great burgers. Finally, the staff was super friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. They recommended where to eat, what to do & how to get there. Even the wait staff & groundskeepers were always smiling and friendly. Asking if there was anything they could get us or help us with. Very accommodating staff who made us feel very welcome. You will not be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romance in Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: HarryJay
Reviews.Content: Wonderful over-sized, beautifully appointed room, extremely obliging and attentive staff (we had the Sangiovese suite with complimentary breakfast served in our room--worth it!), really lovely pool area with comfy lounges, quiet, intimate and elegant. Best for couples, a lovely relaxing oasis to return to after wine tasting. We have been to Napa many times, and stayed in several places in Yountville but will return again here for luxury coupled with value. Any very minor problems or questions were handled immediately by staff and we really appreciated manager's personal attention--it really made a difference to us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing getaway in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: Kutty1101
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights mid June. We came to Yountville for a relaxing getaway, and the Napa Valley Lodge was the perfect oasis. We had a fireplace King room with vineyard view. The room was very large, with an even bigger bathroom. We had a private patio that overlooked a nice vineyard area. The pool area was lovely. Pool & hot tub were very clean, and temps refreshing. They always had plenty of oversized bath towels for around the pool use. The eveningoutdoor fire was a great way to relax with a glass of wine. The room included a daily Champagne breakfast. There were 2 very hardworking girls that made sure everything on the buffet was well-stocked. Wonderful selection of pastries, hot foods, waffles, fruit, veges, coffee & teas, and champagne. We were so glad we chose the Yountville area over Napa. It REALLY was where we wanted to be for dinner, and starting our daily wine tasting adventures. The staff was helpful, and quiet. (which is what we prefer). We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect all around”
Reviews.Author: margaretm56
Reviews.Content: My son and I enjoyed our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. Booked with the hotel for a park view room and we were upgraded to a pool view room. Beds are comfortable and bathroom was roomy. Rooms were quiet and I even kept the sliding patio door open for the breeze at night. Included breakfast buffet had something for everyone. Perfect spot for our travels around the Napa Valley. Some of the best restaurants in the Napa Valley are in Yountville. Highly recommend the Napa Valley Lodge and would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: brianlarsen71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our two children to Napa valley this June. It was the first time we stayed at the lodge as it was recommended by one of the wineries that we are wine club memebers. It was a beautfiul hotel that overlooked a vineyard. There was a beautiful park across the road that the kids just loved. There was a free breakfast in the morning that had plenty of options for the family, including champagne for the adults. At night, we sat out by the pool that had a fire pit under a pergala. We would sit out by the fire with a glass of wine. It could not have been a more perfect setting. We were also walking distance from downtown Yountville that happens to be home of some of the finest restuarants in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Average lodge - do not expect much from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheLeo
Reviews.Content: I am writing this reviewing while staying that the lodge! As a background - I am a very well traveled person and ALL my vacations are ALWAYS planned using Tripadvisor reviews. This one seems to have been the only disappointment that I can remember of. Cons: - Do not be deceived by the pictures of vineyard outside your room balcony. We booked based on that and the "valley view" turned out to be the view of a hill in a distance beyond the pool and yard area. More like a pool view room. I really have to wonder the genuineness of the pictures posted by people. From the map I was given by front desk, the vineyard view rooms must be maybe less than a dozen in this decently large property. Again - don't get deceived by the pics. - Also, upon checking in, I was not given any overview of the amenities and/or the activities at the lodge. I had to actually ask if there was anything I should know of. - When checking in on Wednesday I was informed of wine tasting at the lodge every Thursday & Friday. I was checking out Friday morning so we came back from our trip to Napa on Thursday so that we can enjoy the wine tasting. Guess what - wine tasting was suddenly moved to Friday!! That's unbelievably crap service from a lodge that charges over 365 bucks a night! - The moment I entered the room I got a nauseating smell that was explained by the really old carpeting in the room. Bring some spray with you. Had to ask my wife to spray some perfume to get over the smell. - No elevators if you are carrying lots of luggage like we are due to our 2 week long trip with a kid - For the money - I think there might be better options like Hotel Yountville, etc. I only came to know about it from the tourism book in the room. Definitely not worth the money we paid. We got gorgeous hotels (again from tripadvisor) in San Diego, Santa Monica & Monterey for way less than this (this is our 4th destination in California trip) Pros: - the breakfast was pretty good and I think they have done a good job with the buffet. - The bathroom is totally updated. I really looks good. However, it doesn't seem very well planned. The towels are quite a distance away from the shower and above the toilet. - The furniture in the room is good quality. The bed skirt doesn't go well with the bed as it seems bit older. Again - the newer carpeting or wooden flooring will do a huge service to this lodge. - From my balcony I definitely can see a nice pool and firepit area with deck chairs. Looks good! Will try when a wedding party is over (was suppose to have wine tasting there) - They do have free wifi - but no security on it :( - Free parking!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed an extra night”
Reviews.Author: JJasonBlair
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the lodge. We didn't take much advantage of the staff, but they were friendly and unobtrusive. The pool area is very comfortable, with luxe lounge beds and a bocci court nearby. On weekends the pool has a staff person who brings above average drinks. Great location, great setting. We walked to dinner at Ad Hoc and REDD and found the walk just far enough to work up an appetite - or to work off dinner. Great beds, as well!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: jd.nichols
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time during our stay over Memorial Day weekend. The room was spacious and clean. We enjoyed the breakfast in the morning. You could make your own waffles! It was quite delicious and we all left feeling nice and full ready for a day of wine tasting. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We asked them for more towels and coffee and someone was at our room lickity split with our requests in hand. We also had a birthday during our stay and the cake we ordered was quite large. The hotel staff gladly stored it for us in their fridge. We could see the hot air balloons taking off in the morning from our bedroom window (we had a room overlooking the courtyard). We shared our room with another couple. We found the bathroom challenging as the â€˜get ready areaâ€™, toilet and shower were all together so no dividing area for the girls to get ready while one of the guys showered. It worked out fine for us as weâ€™re pretty close to the other couple we were traveling with. We found it weird that the coffee maker was located right next to the toilet. Of course, my husband thought it was great that he didnâ€™t have to get off the pot to enjoy his next cup of java. The beds were comfy but 3 out of 4 of us thought the pillows were too puffy. Can we get a flat pillow please?! Ha ha. The pool and fire pit closed at 10pm â€“ which we found a bit disappointing but can understand the reasoning behind it. We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: mfedfe
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, very nice rooms, great pool and patio area - a place to enjoy the Wine Country

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MM_Excursions
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. We quite enjoyed the lovely robes they offer, the balcony, and the comfy beds. Great location where you can walk into downtown Yountville very easily and also quickly hit the road for wine tastings. Beautiful pool, hot tub, and fire pit. Lovely breakfast included. The service could have been a bit better, but I know they had one front desk staffer out sick while we were there. It made them short staffed and you had to wait a while to discuss things with them. It also made it impossible for them to do much for us when we had a food poisoning issue. All in all it was a very nice stay at a great hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but the Price is High, though typical for the area and season”
Reviews.Author: solomentehawaii
Reviews.Content: We just returned for a trip to Napa. We chose Napa Valley Lodge for its location in Yountville, as we had three dining reservations there, and wanted to walk to dinner each night. Positives: --accomodating staff --good morning breakfast buffet for hotel complimentary breakfast (delicious coffee, lots of fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs...fairly simple but really a great start) --free wifi...most higher end hotels charge --free parking, but you're in a residential area across from a park so probably not a big deal --comfortable rooms with updated bathrooms. the shower and vanity area are great, but no tub in our room --nice pool area --work out area a little small but functional Negatives --first room I heard the people above us...must have been an old dude with an enlarged prostate because I heard walking about three times between 11pm and 6am. --first room had curve in bed from use --PRICE, we paid $325/night which seems high for me. Yountville is just a pricey little town and this is probably Market Value. You are paying for the location but I know you could get a pretty sweet hotel for this price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place - great location”
Reviews.Author: Spartyhomer
Reviews.Content: Wonderful spot. Large, well designed rooms. Good amenities. Excellent location. Good breakfast for free. Cheerful and helpful staff. The only possible downside were the beds - though very soft and comfortable, the mattress sloped towards the side of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elmrosie
Reviews.Content: We picked this to be in Yountville in case we got THE CALL from being on the French Laundry's wait-list, The call never came, but we were glad of the hotel choice. This is great place to stay, comfortable rooms, free wifi, excellent breakfast (although it seemed to have a plague of locusts around it, i.e. our fellow guests), nice pool and small gym. Good advice on local vineyards etc and helpful for booking. Nice central location. Would definitely return and like this small chain, having also stayed in the Monterey Bay Plaza on the same trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Kapyb
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and clean but the noise level is high. The patio door is very thin and any noise from the courtyard filters into the room. The entry door needs to have weather stripping installed to keep the noise out. Housekeeping is exceptional here and should be recognized.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sbv10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, there was a chilled bottle of Chardonnay waiting on us in the room. We loved it so much, that we ordered another bottle to be delivered to the pool while we lounged around there. We had two package nights that were great. We did the hot air balloon ride (it was cancelled the first morning due to wind, but was quickly rescheduled for the next day). The lodge handled all the reservations and transportation. We also had a chaffeured sedan package that the lodge handled. We LOVED both excursions and would recommend doing both through the lodge. The room itself was great, with a fireplace, and view of the vineyards. Just beautiful. The breakfast was delicious and expansive. And the hotel staff was very helpful with area recommendations. Hotel was not directly inside the town so was quiet and exactly what we were looking for, but was within a short walking distance to make the restaurants convenient, too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value; would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: wilson315
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights here earlier this month and were really disappointed in our stay. The bad: broken A/C in our room; no safes in the room and only very small safety deposit boxes available in the lobby (so not big enough to lock up laptops, camera equipment, etc.); the fireplace "upgrade" includes a Duraflame fake log and can't even be used unless the A/C and fan are off and the door is closed, otherwise smoke fills the room (so basically, unless the weather is really cold, it's not usable); front desk was extremely unreliable in making the reservations we requested (they told us they made one but actually didn't; they told us that another winery that we wanted to try didn't take reservations and we could go anytime, but when we got there, they apparently did take reservations, so we had to wait almost an hour before getting in); the hotel is very old and thus extremely noisy--we heard every footstep in the room above us; views are not very scenic--just a 1/4 acre hobby vineyard and the freeway (which is also pretty noisy); pool was not heated as advertised; price--given the above flaws, this hotel was outrageously overpriced, even for high season The good: decent-looking pool area, which was never very crowded; location (on one end of Yountville, so about 3/4 of a mile to the furthest place in town); free wireless internet and free parking

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of wine country, comfortable, friendly and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Vermont311
Reviews.Content: This was our forth visit to NVL and wine country. The lodge is perfectly located for visits to vineyards and fabulous restaurants are within walking distance. Our grown daughters were with us and we had great fun catching up with each other by the pool and around the fire pit. Breakfasts were delicious and could be eaten inside or out. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: BruceGWood
Reviews.Content: Yet again another wonderful stay here in mid-Napa! Our flight got cancelled and we were FORCED to stay another day! Great rooms and a really nice breakfast to start the day! Worth every penny! We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon suite!”
Reviews.Author: davidbelden
Reviews.Content: We were getting married in Napa and needed a hotel to stay at the night prior to and the night of our wedding. The Napa Valley Lodge was perfect! The setting was amazing, complete with vineyards outside our balcony and a very relaxing pool and courtyard. This is one of the nicest hotels we've stayed at and we'll definitely be returning for more. - Great location - Easy walking distance to downtown Yountville and wonderful restaurants - Lovely pool & courtyard - Fabulous, spacious shower We stayed in the Bella Vista Suite which is fantastic! Fluffy pillows, quiet sitting room, amazing bathroom with dual shower heads, a comfy bed, and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: BostonSkibum
Reviews.Content: This is a simply lovely hotel. The rooms are attractive, spacious, up to date and very comfortable. The landscaping and grounds are beautiful. Loved the pool area and the fire pit is perfect for a night cap. Finally, the staff is friendly and welcoming. Just great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for romance”
Reviews.Author: CitBree
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay here during a business trip. The rate I got was pretty high that I probably would have looked for something cheaper if I was going on my own dime. The room was gorgeous -- very large. I could probably do a cartwheel in it. It had a ceiling fan and a balcony, which were nice touches that added to the elegance. The bathroom had that spa sort of feeling to it. Maybe the shower had inlaid stones, I don't remember. I just remember it was a nice bathroom. I guess like anywhere in Napa/Sonoma, there was a winery next door (or at least a grape field?). It must have been the season because the whole area smelled like wine. I loved waking up to that smell! The breakfast is pretty good. It's in a building by the pool so you can sit outside and just enjoy the peace if you'd like. I know they had a waffle maker, but I'm not sure I remember anything else "hot." But there was a lot of fruit, yogurt, cereal, bread and pastries. I was in town for an event in St. Helena, which made it a little of drive to and from, but you could probably make this a destination if you are traveling as a couple. There are plenty of wineries to visit nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and amenities, walking distance to superb dining”
Reviews.Author: Autometric
Reviews.Content: Helpful, knowledgeable and courteous staff. Nice pool,, deck and hot tub. We took advantage of the couple's, in room massage available from the on site spa. Great location in upper Yountville close to Domain Chandon vineyard. Easy access to 29 and Silverado trail.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Afdahl
Reviews.Content: Nancy and Beverlee in the sales dept made planning my corporate event there painless and pleasant. They were extremely knowledgeable and guided me with suggestions for planning our teambuilding excursions. Rooms were great and we loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “The Napa Valley Lodge was the beginning of a terrific visit to wine country.”
Reviews.Author: ednaGardenGrove_CA
Reviews.Content: Our room was delightful, overlooking grape arbors and mountains. The staff were always pleasant and seemed to enjoy their roles as providers of a great experience as much as I enjoyed mine as a first-time visitor to wine country. The accommodations were very good, but it was the people who made my stay a real delight. Thanks folks. Staying with you was grand.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy and very friendly and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Angeldovep7
Reviews.Content: We really liked the room it was rommy enough that the three of us could move around with out bumping into each other . The beds were comfortable and it was nice and quiet. The complementary breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel in the heart of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a few days in California wine country. We have often passed by the Napa Valley Lodge (on Highway 29 in Yountville) but this was our first overnight stay. We were extremely pleased with the comfort of the hotel, especially the large rooms, the soft bed linens, the luxurious bathrobes and the fabulous pillows. (I'm picky about pillows.) We were also impressed by the courteous helpfulness of the front desk staff. A large breakfast included in the room price was an added bonus. We look forward to a repeat visit!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey but it's a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: INebula123
Reviews.Content: My favorite part was the fireplace in the room. It is very romantic and cozy and was nice to snuggle up to after a late night dip in the pool/hot tub. Unfortunately we woke up too late to enjoy the continental breakfast before our couples massage, but it looked to be a great spread. I'd go back there for another weekend getaway but would not be able to afford this place for a longer stay...

Reviews.Title: “A cozy, intimate setting in beautiful Younteville. A home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: LydL7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were planning to attend a wedding in Napa and we booked a room months ahead at Napa Valley Lodge. My boyfriend stayed here in the past for business and he highly recommended the hotel. The rates were reasonable; the accomodations were just as nice as other hotels in Younteville, and the staff was very accomodating. I also had to book 2 additional rooms for last minute guests and the staff worked for hard to accomodate my request. They reserved 2 rooms and were generous enough to honor my AAA rate at a last minute. The hotel is located on the main street in Younteville and provides you easy access to all the restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries and of course, the wine bars! The rooms are generous in size, the views are breathtaking as you look out to vineyards and the fireplace adds a cozy, intimate ambience. You will not be dissapointed. Nice room, bed, bathroom, bath robes, fireplace, view, etc. I highly recommend the Napa Valley Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Decent trip to NVL”
Reviews.Author: CTSing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for two nights in late March during a short getaway with my boyfriend for my birthday. After extensive research online, we picked NVL because of its convenient location in Yountville between Napa and St. Helena. A few pros: -location to downtown Yountville (awesome restaurants!) -fireplace!! -big bathroom with huge marble shower -grounds were beautiful -staff was nice and helpful A few cons: -Our room seemed very empty and lacked warmth. It looked as if there used to be two queen beds, and they eliminated one, but left the same amount of furniture (with some carpet stains) We didn't even have two chairs to sit on! One of us always had to sit on the bed. -We weren't really sure what to expect with the breakfast, but it was just alright. We'd suggest eating light and then knowing you'll eat a big lunch! We highly recommend Cindy's Backstreet Grill in St. Helena!!! -The highway backs up to the courtyard and so if your room faces anywhere near the highway, it can be quite noisy at night with trucks and passing cars. Overall, a nice experience. Not sure if we'd stay there again! Too many places to try :)

Reviews.Title: “Great luxery and service at an affordable cost”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirl_11
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and very inviting. It had a fantastic shower! We were pleased that is was close to many wineries and restaurants and we walked to most places that we dined. The hotel also had a pool, hot tub and fire pit that we thoroughly enjoyed and made good use of. The service was excellent and the staff was available to help us with anything we needed. The hotel also offere a free continental champagne breakfast which was great. They had a great variety of fruits, cereals, toast, bagels, a waffle maker, biscuits and gravy and of course champagne! Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravWayne_NJ
Reviews.Content: Recently traveled to California for a week long excusion with friends. Started in Sonoma and moved to Yountville for one night. Although our visit was short, we found the staff very helpful and the accomodations lovely. The room is spacious and the linens and beds were extremely comfortable. The large walk-in bathroom was beautifully appointed. If we find our way back to wine country we'd certainly consider staying at the NVP again. The staff was helpful and helped us ship our wine discoveries back east and all we had to do was drop off the bottles in the lobby and they contacted the vendor to arrange pick-up and deliver. Great way to avoid having to do this on your own! Thanks again for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Jim22207
