Reviews.Content: It's a great deal in a nice hotel in the heart of Napa wine country. The staff was top-notch. Within hours of making our initial reservation, the front desk made our reservations at the French Laundry and sent us other recommendations for restaurants in the area. Upon, arriving they provided plenty of information about regional wineries. It's also within within walking distance to the many incredible restaurants and wineries in Yountville. Free breakfast is served daily and surpasses what most hotels serve as a continental breakfast. I have no complaints and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL, Great location... wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Napa prior to a conference in San Francisco... definitely rent a car, you will want one for exploring the area. Yountville is one of several smaller towns along highway 29 that runs the whole length of Napa Valley. This hotel was awesome. The rooms are very large, even with 4 suitcases, we still had room left over.... the desk and free internet is great.... the rooms have wood burning fireplaces and they heat the room enough to not have to run the heat at night... The continental breakfast is the best I have ever had, and I travel quite a lot. The egg salad was good, waffles, fruit, cheeses, different breads, wonderful coffee, and the staff is great refilling food as its barely empty... oh yeah and they provide champagne for mimosas with their breakfast!! The firepit by the pool is a great place to meet after a long day of wine tasting to drink some more wine... the grounds are immaculate with beautiful flowers and very clean. Wonderful hotel, worth every penny, especially with the breakfast included. Very quiet, never heard the neighbors through the walls..... one note, if you don't like traffic noise, then as for a room that has a patio that faces the park rather than the grapevines which are next to the road. The noise never bothered us as its pretty quiet at night

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: dillydallying
Reviews.Content: My son, my mother and I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge in February 2011. The Lodge is just off Route 29 in Yountville. It is a pretty Mediterranean-style, two-story lodge. We asked for an upper level room upon check in and received one with a courtyard/pool view. The rooms are perfect with plenty of space, GREAT marble bathrooms with a glass shower, comfortable beds, a perfect balcony (or patio) for relaxing, and free wi-fi (a great added feature). We loved the location because we were able to take a ten minute walk down the lovely main street for our dinners and shopping into the heart of Yountville. There are a few wineries a stone's throw away from the lodge and the friendly lady at check-in gave us some coupons for tastings at the local places. The pool at the lodge was great! We swam in February - the weather was quite mild - and the heated pool and hot tub were in a beautiful courtyard. We had to take advantage of it. There is also a firepit with comfy outdoor loungers and chairs to bask in the glow and warmth at night. The champagne breakfast buffet was WONDERFUL! With numerous choices - a huge full breakfast is offered with everything from fruits, cheeses, meat, cereals, breads, make-your-own waffles, salads, yogurt, pastries, juices, teas, coffee, and the champagne. Delightful. The town of Yountville is simply beautiful and a great place for families and couples and singles. Plenty of world-class dining options (we even had a gourmet dining experience with my 5-year-old son) are available. The staff were excellent and accomodating. The only thing I didn't like was having to leave!

Reviews.Title: “What a Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveller031511
Reviews.Content: What can I say.....great service, great room, great ammenities, great breakast (included). Outdoor firepit and pool area were superb in enclosed courtyard. Great location. Very clean. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Larry R
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the NVL. The service was wonderful and the location central to wineries and great restaurants. Could not have asked for a nicer room. Price is a little higher than others, but I guarantee you will get what you pay for. Larry Rau

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara1426
Reviews.Content: My husband and I hoped to rest and relax while in the Napa Valley for a wedding, and we found the ability to do that at the Napa Valley Lodge. The rooms were clean and the beds were SO comfortable. There was a delightful breakfast served daily and lovely outdoor space in which to relax. The spa services -- oh where do I begin! The in-room couples massage was so relaxing and so good. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in the Napa Valley area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: wildberrydesigns
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from NVL. Stayed 3 nights Feb. 23-26th 2011. This location is a "10". Loved having all the nice resturants and small wine tasting rooms within a short walk. My husband and daughter rented bikes across the street at Napa Valley Bikes and loved riding the Silverrado Trail. We drove to all the wineries we planed on, Del Dotto was our #1 choice, loved Prine Ridge, Peju, Duckhorn and Rubicorn just to name a few. We had 2 great meals at Pacific Blues Cafe which we walked to and brought our own wine. The hotel was more than we could have asked for. We got a nice bottle of wine delivered to our door, the room was very large, 2 queen beds that were so comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous and spacious. Very clean, and restocked everyday. We had a nice patio. The breakfest buffet was over the top, something for everyone including Champagne and OJ each day. The grounds were so beautiful even in winter, hot tub and fire pit were great in the cold weather. Hope to return and use the pool in warmer weather. If you are considering a trip to Napa, this is the best location and would return to NVL next time. LOVED IT. J & J Stoneham, MA.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: SAM175
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 3 nights at the Napa Valley Lodge. We chose a King suite, which was beautiful. They have a delicious, complimentary, "full continental" breakfast, which we had the option of receiving in our room. The pool, patio, area has a nice fire pit for evenings. The best thing about the hotel, though, is the staff. They were friendly, helpful, and even called us before we arrived to help us arrange winery tours and restaurant reservations. There are many lovely hotels in the valley, including this one, but we will definitely stay there again, hugely because of the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Poellnitz
Reviews.Content: NPV is a quaint lodge located walking distance from best restaurants and shops located in near downtown Yountville. I have stayed here on numerous occasions with my boyfriend and the service never fails, and what continues to bring be back three times a year. Reasonably price and an abundance of amenities that allow you to feel like your on vacation in wine country of France. Customer service is divine, staff is always welcoming and ecstatic to help your stay be memorable. So much to say, but why bother you with words, book your stay with NPV and experience hospitably and luxury at it's best!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Yountville, probably better choices in wine country”
Reviews.Author: shesays
Reviews.Content: Napa Valley Lodge was chosen due to the proximity to the great restaurants in Yountville, and it definitely cannot be faulted in that respect. A short walk from French Laundry, Bouchon, Bistro Jeanty, etc. The receptionist was really helpful with restaurant recommendations and books. 4/5 for service is due to breakfast being only so-so and the breakfast area being kind of messy. The rooms are a little dated, and we paid to upgrade to a deluxe fireplace with views room, and I guess I expected a little more. We could see the highway from our room, albeit over a vineyard. Overall I would recommend the hotel, as this is still nice, with comfy beds, and a cheaper option than others in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of Napa Valley to stay!”
Reviews.Author: 3298Val
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms with fireplaces; great breakfast included; loved the jacuzzi and the pool; walking distance to Yountville for eating/shopping; great location in Napa Valley. Very friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed biking from the hotel on the Silverado Trail. Many places to hike nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “great location right in the heart of the Napa valley, so pretty, cute courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: Runner7889
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge was so fun and great location right in downtown Yountville. It was walking distance from many restaurants, and a couple winery's. The Lodge was right at the start of the heart of Napa Valley. no more than 30 minutes from 200 winery's. The courtyard was very cute with a bocce ball court, a fire pit and pool all in the grassy courtyard. It is set in a vineyard very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Mini-Vacay”
Reviews.Author: lksugarman
Reviews.Content: I was able to take advantage of a Zozi coupon, but Napa Valley Lodge is a bargain at full price. From the moment I walked in to check in, everything was perfect. I was warmly greeted. I had a room at the far end looking out over a vineyard. A great bottle of wine awaited me in the spotless room. Internet was fast and free. Loved the beautiful renovated bathrooms and first-class toiletries. Unfortunately, I did not have time to go for a swim or use the hot tub. But, I can't wait to go back and swim some laps in the beautiful, heated pool. Breakfast was very nice, bountiful, and fresh. If I have to offer one less than glowing comment, it would be that my bed, sheets, and pillows at home are more to my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: RBEL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned and had a great experience at the lodge. It was clean and the rooms were very nice and we especially enjoyed the patio and fireplace. The location is terrific and within walking distance of some of the Napa valleys top restaurants. In addition, the breakfast offered is terrific and very convient. All in all, an excellent experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would return to the Napa Valey Lodge every time.”
Reviews.Author: Drew1811
Reviews.Content: Our group of 20 were treated very well and enjoyed our stay tremendously. The service was very polite and professional. The rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service and fantastic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_G7448
Reviews.Content: We are from the East Bay and we stayed at the Napa Valley Nodge for New Year's and I can't say enough about the service we received. We arrived early for check-in and Cassie at the front desk took my cell phone number so that she could call as soon as our room was ready. She then gave me a packet with passes for free wine tastings at wineries within walking distance of the hotel in Yountville. We went to enjoy some wine and within an hour, I receieved a call that our room was ready. On checking in, Cassie not only changed our room to one with a better view, but when she learned of our plans to attend a New Year's party at Domaine Chandon, she let us know that there was a shuttle we could take to the event and told us she would call us with details on when they would arrive. We settled into our room. It was vvery roomy, had a nice fireplace that kept us warm throughout the night and had an incredibly comfortable bed. As promised, Cassie from the front desk not only called with information on the shuttle pick-up for our party, but also gave us the card of a local car service we could call to pick us up after the event since the shuttle wasn't running that late. This was extremely helpful since calling a cab would have meant a wait of 30 minutes to an hour. In the morning, the hotel also provides a really nice sit down continental breakfast for its guests. We had a very nice stay here and the personal service we received will bring us back here whenever we stay in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than the web site!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFromIowa10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful room with a fireplace, which was perfect for the cool December nights. The champagne breakfasts were served in a cozy building away from the guest rooms, also with a fire burning every morning. The food was excellent and plentiful. The location was easy to find and ideally situated in wine country, yet close to San Francisco. If we ever come back to the area we'll stay at Napa Valley Lodge, and we have recommended it to everyone we know!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: adboud11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay a couple nights at the Napa Valley Lodge to celebrate a brief babymoon. We are expecting our first child next month and needed a break after the holiday commotion to enjoy some real alone time, knowing that it might not happen again for a while. The room we stayed in was beautiful and overlooked the vineyards surrounding part of the property. The bed was incredibly comfortable (not small feat when you're 7 1/2 months pregnant) and we loved enjoying the fireplace while it rained outside. It was also within walking distance of the quaint downtown area where we had dinner one night at Bottega, which was excellent. During the day, we looked around the little shops. I would've loved to visit the numerous wine tasting salons in town; many of them have wines I really enjoy. We don't live very far away, and have had occasion to try them out before, and hopefully will again soon. The staff was especially courteous and very helpful throughout our stay, routinely delivering extra supplies to our room, and graciously fulfilling our requests. I had a 90 minute spa treatment as well that was heavenly, and very necessary right in my room. The pool and jacuzzi were both heated and we were able to have a lovely dip/soak at night. Overall, the accommodations were lovely and just what we needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a little getaway. You really can't beat the location or the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act - Accomodations and service were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: B_Allan01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property many years ago in its previous incarnation as a Best Western motel, and were always pleased with its location, nestled in the vineyards in the Napa Valley wine country on the edge of Yountville, with its shops, world class restaurants, and proximity to extraordinary wineries. A number of years ago, it was acquired, seriously expanded, and luxuriously upgraded by Woodside Hotels, a small group of award winning, upscale hotels and lodges in Northern California. Having driven by it many times on previous wine country trips, we decided to make a reservation via their website to stay for a night for a special occasion. When we arrived, the room configuration that we requested based upon information on the property's website was not available, and the hotel was fully booked that night. However, the Hotel Operations Manager stepped in and made a very acceptable accommodation. Clearly service is at the top of the list at Napa valley Lodge. We were extremely pleased with the room, the breakfast buffet, the facilities, and the attentive service. This facility is definitely a class act, and a cut above other similar properties in the area. We will return, and will encourage our friends to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “A truly sublime and magical time for our family!”
Reviews.Author: daryldee
Reviews.Content: Our family took a trip to Napa for a weekend to just enjoy some time together. Our children are in their early twenties and now lead very independent lives. We all wanted some family time. I chose Napa Valley Lodge from looking at the web site. It looked lovely and offered a champagne breakfast. When we arrived we were impressed right from the start. We had hot cider in the lobby while checking in. Both our rooms were lovely and comfortable and extremely clean. We found the staff to be most helpful and professional. They helped us make dinner reservations and we loved our champagned breakfast the next morning in the lovely fireside/poolside dining area. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Jay4228
Reviews.Content: This was are second time at The Napa Valley Lodge and it was as good as I remembered. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and well kept grounds. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, friendly staff, cozy room, great breakfast, excellent group booking experience.”
Reviews.Author: lisameow
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, nothing but the best. I contacted NVL to arrange for a group block of rooms. Nancy was so accommodating, took care of everything. Our room was exceptional, so roomy and one of the nicest we've stayed anywhere. It was cozy without being frilly but updated without being overly cold or modern--just right! View of courtyard was great, my family's vineyard view was amazing. Breakfast was plentiful, workout room was adequate. All staff were extra friendly and went out of their way to take care of every little detail. We'd go back and would send friends there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this GREAT hotel ! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: love5pets
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at this lovely hotel and would highly recommend it. We originally were going to stay in a deluxe King room but it was not available all the nights we planned to stay so we were upgraded to a huge Luxury Suite (Meritage Suite # 7) and it was fabulous. We overlooked the pool area from our patio but it was always quiet. The pool is heated which was a big plus for our usage. Huge marble bathroom with a separate shower and a jacuzzi tub, even a real fireplace. We had relaxing massages and a facial while there and visited the fitness room as well. A nice breakfast is also included each morning and there was a complimentary laptop in the lobby we could use. The staff and service were so nice and helpful. We would highly recommend staying here. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: gdnyc
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. as clean as could be and the staff was accomodating. walking distance from the town of yountville. lost points because when they consider a "full vineyard view" is really 10 vines, route 29 and in my case, the adjoining building. nice room but very disappointed when i opened the curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AustinAussie
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley lodge is ideally situated inn the charming town of Yountville and a short drive from all the fabulous vineyards near by. Our room was spacious, clean and tastefully, yet simply appointed. The bathroom was immaculate and recently renovated with lovely tile and seamless shower. We had a great little patio overlooking the pool. The plus was that it was within walking distance of the fabulous restaurants such as French Laundry and Bouchon. We did not eat their breakfast buffet, opting to walk to local eateries instead. The lodge is more like a motel in the sense that the room doors face outside to the parking lot, but we really enjoyed our stay there. The Location was fabulous and I plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: earthangel53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best in Napa Valley! The rates are reasonable, the location is best because from here we could drive north or south within minutes to places like St Helena, Calistoga etc. I recommend getting on SILVERADO TRAIL and drive north for most scenic drive from hotel. We visted Chateau Domain winery and took the Cocktail tour which is close to hotel just up the road then we drove up to Calistoga taking the Silverado Trail to Chateau Monteleana/this is a must do as the winery is the one made movie of for their Paris wine award and we made no reservations just walkd in and got to see them harvesting the grapes and the wine tasting was terrific. Stop at Cafe Sarafonia for a great lunch in Calistoga and have dinner at Bistro Jeaunty in Yountville. Oh what a trip we had it was beautiful and unforgetable and we will stay at this same hotel next time in the area. Highly, highly recommend this one! The room was comfortable, modern but cozy w a fireplace and beautiful bathroom w very comfortable beds after a long flight and porch area and romantic and great choc chip cookies and coffee! It sits right at corner off highway and was in very best location to everything in the area! All the staff did everything to accomodate us and answer all our travel questions and friendly and professional. Its a must stay hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Glorious place!”
Reviews.Author: amc1958
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely wonderful find! Great big room, comfy bed, nice fireplace. Deluxe bathroom with gorgeous tile shower! Terrific workout facility! Breakfast that was really delicious and included in the stay! Fun firepit to sit around and enjoy the wine that you purchased on your daytime journeys to the many wineries!!! Just a delightful place.... I want to go back.... next week!!!! Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jmtraveller99
Reviews.Content: We went to Napa Valley Lodge for our Anniversary and I was very happy with their helpfulness. They made us a reservation for dinner at a restaurant and also, I e-mailed them to ask if there was a magnifying mirror in the bathroom. There wasn't, so I brought my own travel size version, (which is quite distorted and I fear that I might make myself look like a clown) but when we got there I discovered a beautiful stand-up magnifying mirror in the bathroom!! It was a delightful surprise! Thank you Cassandra!!! Our room had a fantastic terrace with a view of a nice big Oak tree and the vineyard. Breakfast was more than I expected. There was a waffle maker and a really nice variety of fruits, cheeses, meats, cereal, yogurt, etc , etc. etc and Champagne! I highly recommend this friendly and beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: StevePatBismarck
Reviews.Content: This beautiful lodge and property was the prefect stay in the Napa Valley area. Great location - close to all activities and restuarants in the Valley. The relaxing and quiet time was much needed. Thank you for your hospitality. Steve & Pat, Bismarck, ND

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Napa Valley Tours”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCouple763
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Napa Valley Lodge for 4 nights in September, 2010. The rooms were clean, bright and roomy. The only thing we didn't like is that it's a two storey motel structure, with room doors opening onto the outside which leads to a bit of noise when people are entering or leaving their rooms. Otherwise, our ground level room opened onto a vineyard where we had a small, private patio for watching the sunset with (of course) a glass of wine! The hotel includes breakfast in its rates which is a buffet in a room that opens onto the pool area. The buffet includes fruits, muffins, yoghurt, toast, coffee, juices and waffles you make yourself. Otherwise, the hotel has no restaurant or room service. The pool area wasn't busy, so it was easy to get a spot in the late afternoon after visiting a few wineries. There was a light bar service from 3 - 7 p.m. around the pool. The hotel's location was great since you could walk down the street to restaurants that are world class (i.e. The French Laundry, Bouchon) or hop in your car to get to St. Helena in 10 minutes for shopping and restaurants. Napa Valley Bike Tours is right across the street, offering both guided tours and self tours of the valley. While we enjoyed the hotel, we might try the new Hotel Luca just down the street next time, a more traditional boutique hotel. For $390 per night on weekends ($299 during the week), we weren't expecting a motel-like resort without a restaurant, but then perhaps I didn't pay enough attention to the hotel's website when researching the property! I would recommend the property to friends with the caveats mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere that provided for a wonderful stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: KickinKay
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge! The staff was very welcoming and helpful in planning our tours to the various vineyards and restaurants in the area. Also, the rooms are very spacious and provide a nice place to come back to in the evenings after a busy day. One of our favorite aspects was the outside decor around the pool area complete with a fire pit to relax by, as well as a wonderful breakfast each morning. We would defiintely stay here again, and also with its centralized location, it makes it a perfect pick for a stay in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Napa Valley Lodge in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: DennisfromNaplesFL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I could not have been more pleased with our 4 days at the Napa Valley Lodge. Our room with a large fireplace opened out right to a beautiful vineyard - 5 feet from our patio! The entire property was perfectly maintained. Very extensive complimentary breakfast (and Wall Street Journal) next to the swimming pool each morning. Eat inside or out - your choice. Very helpful staff. Great location; we could walk to all of the many, many fine restaurants and shops in Yountville. Easy and quick access to the highway running up and down Napa Valley to visit the vineyards and wineries both north and south. We live in Florida, and loved our visit to the Napa Valley. We plan to return with the rest of our family to the Napa Valley Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot conveniently located for exploring Yountville and the Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: LondonRob1961
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is a super hotel on the edge of Yountville, within walking distance of all its restaurants. It is comfortable, there is plenty of parking, the rooms are large and the swimming pool a decent size. A lovely spot and great base to explore the winelands.

Reviews.Title: “I loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: Barney_Beans
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! The service was excellent and I can't say enough about our stay there. We especially loved: our room had a fireplace; a balcony with 2 chairs and a table overlooking the pool, vineyards and beautiful grounds; firepit with cozy chairs; 3 fountains outside and a bocci pit; breakfast was included and it was superb, along with champagne; walking distance to wine tasting (our favorite was Jessup's), market, restaurants and stores; very lovely bathroom with a huge tiled shower and robes to wear; and the view was fantastic. We would eat breakfast outside by the vineyards or huge courtyard by the pool or inside a huge room with a fireplace. Just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy , clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: thaught
Reviews.Content: Great place for a romantic get away. Rooms were very clean and well appointed. The staff was really attentive and helpful....they knew the area well and gave us great suggestions on where to eat , wineries to go to etc....also had a wonderful in room message. Pool area is nice . We enjoyed a fun game of boccie ball with other guest and the fire pit after dinner was great way to end the day. Perfect get away...can't wait to get back

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Done in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. Since the hotel is significantly less expensive than most of the other options in Yountville, I had been a bit concerned about whether we would be happy here, but I very pleased. The Lodge is an excellent value for this area, and a very pleasant place to stay. The room was large and attractive, the bathroom was extremely nice (comparable to, and indeed better than, many high-end hotels), and the robes were spa-quality. (The room itself was much nicer than our room at the Westin in Napa last summer.) The pool area was quite inviting, too, with comfortable, well-padded lounge chairs, umbrellas, and beverage service. It is obvious from the grounds and the little extra touches that the owners have taken great pains to make the Lodge a nice place to stay. We had a ground-floor, deluxe king room with a view of a vineyard about 15 feet away, and while there was a road behind the vineyard, this still made for a nice view. The Lodge is a further walk from the restaurants and "downtown" area of Yountville than the other hotels (about a 10-15 minute walk, and only about half a block from the new Hotel Luca) but we really enjoyed the walk. Indeed, the walk - which goes past the gardens, the French Laundry, and other hotels - was one of our favorite things about staying in Yountville. We'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, beautiful setting, perfect place to stay in the Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: jeswatek
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. It was the perfect place to stay in the Napa Valley. The town of Yountville, CA is beautiful. It has the best restaurants, great shops, delicious bakery, streets to wonder and spectacular views! It is so easy to get to the vineyards, and there are many wine tasting opportunities in downtown. The hotel provided free wine tasting in the lobby many evenings. The hotel breakfast was delicious. Relaxing in the hot tub or sitting by the fire pit in the evening was the perfect ending to a glorious day in the wine country. I would recommend staying on the 2nd floor as we could hear people above us. Also a room with a view is best!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect surroundings reminiscent of a Tuscan Villa...”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne082
Reviews.Content: Attractive Tuscan exterior with very comfortable 2 queen-bed room with terrace and bathroom which accommodated 2 people getting ready at the same time. Glass enclosed shower, separate make-up table area and 1 sink. Advertised champagne continental breakfast was more than expected...waffle grill for fresh waffles, large assortment of fruits, breads, cereals, juices, meats and cheeses. Daily Wall Street Journal. Well maintained pool and spa area with lots of umbrellas, towels, and beverage pool service. Mature foliage, several fountains, which all offerred a peaceful and rejuvenating ambience.

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary Road Trip - West Coast”
Reviews.Author: DJFarrell
Reviews.Content: We couldn't be more satisfied with our stay at the NVL. We always enjoy staying at properties with higher end amenities and NVL was a perfect fit. Great Service from check-in to check-out. Since this was our 25th Anniversary trip, I thought ahead and ordered a flower arrangement to be left in our room upon arrival. Something happened, and the flowers were not in our room upon arrival. I simply called the front desk and the host gladly ordered one of the best flower arrangements that my wife has ever received (at lease from me)....and you guessed it, no charge! This type of service is hard to find anywhere, at any price. With regards to the room and views, Our room had a great view of the vineyard and the quality of the room fixtures are second to none, again, at any price. Perfect location for dinning and shopping. I highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Great Hotel! Right in the heart of everything Napa Valley has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: sethkamm
Reviews.Content: I planned my first trip to Napa Valley with my girlfriend and it happened to be her birthday. I informed the lodge of this and they had a bottle of wine waiting in our room when we arrived. Nicole, one of the staff members, also took the time to help me plan my entire trip over the phone. She was such a great help and I cannot thank her enough for taking the time. She helped me with everything from the hot air balloon ride to dinner reservations. The hotel also is in a great location. The hotel is right in the center with very quick drives in either direction to wineries, dining, etc. There are also some places to dine just within walking distance! The outside fire pit was an added bonus and made us feel very relaxed. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Napa area. First time or not! I would stay there again for sure!!!!! Thanks again to Nicole and the rest of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lunamayad
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Napa Valley Lodge was so relaxing that we decided to stay for 2 extra days instead of going into San Francisco. When we checked in late at night, they assigned us a room on the 2nd floor (no elevator). Since I was dealing with a knee injury, we asked for a 1st floor room instead. Since there were none available, they gave us a beautiful suite on the 1st floor at no additional charge. When we extended our reservation, they made sure that we were able to stay in the suite. The pool area was peaceful and relaxing and the European style breakfast that was included was excellent. The staff was consistently warm and helpful. The location in Yountville was perfect for enjoying the many wonderful restaurants that were within walking distance. We would definitely stay at Napa Valley Lodge on a return trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel--get the pool view”
Reviews.Author: Half_runner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was as great in person as it was in the pictures. The room had a small balcony that overlooked the pool and fire pit area. Breakfast everyday had a nice variety and the pool was deserted every night. The second day they were there, the management replaced headboards and night stands, so the parking lot was a little crowded, but it was disruptive at all. After that, the room looked more updated. Would recommend this hotel to anyone! One review complained of the view and one side of the hotel did face a park which would be dull. But the upstairs rooms facing the pool are great and really quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The paradise in the middle of Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: BruceGWood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Napa Valley Lodge for the 3rd time in the past 2 years. We have reservations for our next time. The rooms are clean, wonderful - you feel like you are lucky to come to this place. The staff are friendly and they remember you both at the Lodge and over the internet when you correspond via email. There is a nice pool and a sitting area where a perpetual fire is going where you can sit and just relax. A bottle of wine awaited our arrival. Out our window is a picturesque vineyard that greets us whenever we open our window in the morning. Yountville is a quiet town, but also a town of restaurants, activities and shopping. And a world class winery is a short walk, jog or drive away! Try it once, and you will be hard pressed to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very enjoyable stay in a clean, friendly lodge.”
Reviews.Author: 32704Sandy
Reviews.Content: We spent two very enjoyable nights in the Lodge. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very convenient. While we were too busy to have the opportunity to enjoy, the pool and the pool side service looked very relaxing. Also, being able to see the vineyards from the room made the experience even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rain4ester
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the room, especially nice was the deluxe bathroom, a fireplace and patio overlooking the pool, vineyards and mountains. We enjoyed drinks by the pool and it's a short walk to nearby restaurants. Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: hoppersh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge July 11 â€“ 14, 2010. We chose this hotel based on its location and that did not disappoint. Itâ€™s within walking distance to many shops and restaurants and sits by the highway thatâ€™s the main artery through the valley to the most popular wineries. We booked the lowest category room, the Parkview Terrace Queens. The room was nicely furnished and very clean. The view was disappointing, though. A view of the parking lot, a road beyond that, and then further beyond was a gravel area with picnic tables. Considering the beauty of the surrounding areas, this did not measure up. The free wireless internet was great and was accessible throughout the resort, even at the pool. The breakfasts were great as well. Served 8am â€“ 10am, there was a nice assortment of hot and cold choices. Coffee and cookies were available in the lobby in the afternoons, which was great when a snack was needed. The staff was always very polite and friendly. They were helpful in suggesting dining and sightseeing options. We did have a couple of issues, though. We had paid for 3 nights in advance months earlier. After the first night, we returned to our room in the afternoon and our key was not working. When we went to the front desk, they said our reservation was only for one night and we were supposed to have checked out that morning. Thank goodness I had printed our confirmation and brought it with me. After showing that, they made the corrections and gave us new keys. Also, we spent one afternoon at the pool. We had just stretched out and relaxed in the loungers, then 10 minutes later the landscapers showed up with mowers, weedeaters, and leafblowers. The pool area had been empty all day. Why would they wait until after guests showed up to do that work? It was a very small area, so having all of that noise was very frustrating. They finished after about an hour, but hard to relax after that. The grounds and landscaping were beautiful and well maintained. I will say though, that itâ€™s just not the serene and tranquil setting that their website and brochures would lead you to believe. The hotel is surrounded on 3 sides with busy roads. The vineyards that are shown in the brochures are on the back side of the hotel and only visible from the breakfast room and about a dozen of the highest category rooms. Overall, we enjoyed our time there and would recommend this hotel to others based on its location and amenities. The positives outweighed the few negatives that we had and we are glad that we chose this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “More an upscale motel than a hotel, but good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: lupo_mm
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay (four nights) at the Napa Valley Lodge, but I find it hard to agree with some of the more gushing reviews others have given it. The Lodge has a typical motel-layout: reception in the front, parking in front of the rooms, and pool in the middle of the property. Our room was large, tastefully decorated and with a nice bathroom. Still I could not shake the feeling of being in an upscale version of Motel 8. We stayed in a King Room on the first floor with view to the vineyards. Like others have pointed out, the ground floor rooms do not overlook the vineyard, but but look into it. This is actually rather nice. More of a problem is that the vineyard is adjacent to the four lane highway connecting Napa and St. Helena. While sitting outside, there is constant traffic noise including from 18-wheelers speeding past. We still spent time on the terrace because being in the middle of a vineyard is quite unique, but those seeking peace and quiet will be disappointed. The pool area is very nice and peaceful. We spent several afternoons there sipping wine and relaxing. The staff are very friendly and unobtrusive and do not mind at all if you bring your own wine to the pool. There is also a petanque/bocce court and an evening seating area with an open gas fire. Yountville attractions (i.e. the restaurants) are within walking distance, which is a major plus. Overall, we found the Napa Valley Lodge a perfectly fine place to stay, but it does perhaps lack the style that you would normally associate with a property in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to plaza - grape-view rooms”
Reviews.Author: jenlmartin
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the first floor looking right IN to a vineyard. Not OVERLOOKING, like at the same level as - kind of a cool / unusual perspective actually. I think the second floor rooms might have a better view. The room was quite large, had a very nice bathroom area, and even had a fireplace in the corner which would have been nice at a different time of the year. The lodge is a former motel, and it doesn't entirely look like it does in the website/brochure photos. It isn't bad, just not as fabulous as it looks in the pictures (kudos to the marketing team though !). The pool area was nice, but tended to get crowded and there were several families with loud-ish young children that kind of killed the tuscan vibe for us. We really liked being an easy 10 minute walk to most of the fabulous restaurants. One night we went to Mustard's and found out the hard way that the cabs come from elsewhere and therefore charge a flat $30 rate.

Reviews.Title: “Relax enjoy and rejuvenate!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mippymuppett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the bay area and wanted to get away for the weekend without having to fly to our destination. Although Napa is only 45 minutes away once we checked into our hotel we felt miles and miles away from our day to day lives. The Napa Valley Lodge was just what we needed. The service was outstanding. The complimentary breakfast was delicious. Our room was lovely with an incredible view that overlooked the pool and beautiful vine covered hills. We spent one day touring local eateries and wineries and the next day recuperating by the pool. The pool side service was great and my husband and I treated ourselves to massages. Loved loved loved this place. We are already talking about the same exact trip next year!! BTW....the location is fantastic. Yountville is our favorite town. The best restaurants in the area all within walking distance. So feel free to eat, drink, and then safely walk back to the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Getaway...”
Reviews.Author: simplecity
Reviews.Content: The setup of the hotel is kind of like a motel with the entrance to the rooms open to the outdoors, but it was okay because the weather in Napa was amazing when we visited. We had reserved a king room with a fireplace, but the room we were given faced a nearby small cemetery. We asked for another room and were given a double facing the pool/fire pit with a balcony and had no problem with the switch. Room was clean and very comfortable. The pool area is very nice and cuddling up to the fire pit in the evening was great but the area closes too early!! The vineyards are all close by but we definitely needed our car to drive to restaurants and vineyards.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff, excellent location, elegant surroundings”
Reviews.Author: curlai
Reviews.Content: Staff was sincerely friendly, professional and accommodating. Location can't be beat and the rooms are clean. I am a germaphobe so that was important. Not a lot of rooms which is preferable since it was quiet. Absolutely will return. My first trip to Napa and when I called the staff was very helpful in planning itinerary. Fedora, Nicole and Samantha, thank you for making my trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: JudyHughes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night at this lodge. It was centrally located within walking distance to restaurants and shopping areas. We found the staff very knowledgable of the surrounding area and very helpful. Sunday brunch included champagne, fruits, pasteries, and other savory items. The room was very spacious and with all the modern ammenities one would need. The property has a pride of ownship feel to the grounds, and surrounding area. Very comfortable stay; like a home away from home and very reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: steph44w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Francisco and Napa Valley for our 3 year anniversary. The hotel is in a great location. Yountville is right in the middle of Napa Valley with easy access to Napa town in the south and Calistoga in the north. I am glad we chose this area. It is a short walk to the little town of Yountville. The hotel decor is beautiful. The room was great. It overlooked the pool area, bocce court, and the firepit with vineyards in the distance. The room had a fireplace and a balcony and great bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast, which was included, was great. Waffles, fruit, cereal, eggs, granola, bagles, pastries, mimosas- Enough to satisfy. Overall, we loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in beautiful Napa”
Reviews.Author: federalgirl
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and clean. I was pleasantly surprised with the large bathroom especially. It felt luxurious. We were traveling with an infant, and the hotel was accomodating, providing a nice clean crib for her. The hotel is on the end of the town, but the walk is quick--you're really right in the (quiet) middle of everything here. No complaints from these picky travelers!

Reviews.Title: “First night as Husband and Wife”
Reviews.Author: fireandwine2
Reviews.Content: After our amazing wedding we were able to stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. It was the first night as husband and wife and we were so happy that we could be at this lodge. Such a relaxing time before heading out on our honeymoon. Wonderful friendly service, great quiet lush room. Top comfort when you need it the most after a long day....and year of planning our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “A business trip that felt like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: tkav
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel & what a great location in the "HEART" of wine country. All the greatest wineries were only blocks away. The NV Lodge was amazing!! Not only the location but the room, atmosphere and employees were outstanding. Even though I was working last week, this resort made it feel like a vacation. I have already started recommending this resort to friends, coworkers and business associates. Thank you again Napa Valley Lodge for a fantastic week.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lodge, but quite nice......”
Reviews.Author: Major12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights while exploring the Napa Valley recently. It's a very nice property with well kept grounds and a professional staff. The room we had on the second floor was fairly large and very clean, with a nice size balcony. Our check in experience was fine, but the staff is not very forthcoming about local attractions, restaurants, etc. until you drag it out of them. Also they didn't mention the morning breakfast at all and I had to call them to determine where it was located. The breakfast iteself is pretty plain when you consider what you're paying for this place per night.- not impressive compared to other similar properties we have stayed at around the country. You also have to play "where's the hairdyer" - it's hidden in the closet within a black bag, but after hanging clothes in the closet I defy you to find it. Once locate it worked just fine as did everything else in the room. Parking is free and quite convenient to the rooms. Nice pool area as well. Don't think "lodge" when you consider this hotel because it is nothing like a "lodge" as it looks from the street as an upscale motel with outside room entrances. From our point of view it doesn't quite live up to the price charged for a room, but everyone is going to have a different perspective on that and hey, it's in the Napa Valley. But is it quite a nice place, yes it is and we would recommend it to others with a few caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place- a bit of an organization problem”
Reviews.Author: meagjames
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel and probably just caught in during a few days when they weren't at their best. The location was good, the room was very nice and the staff was always pleasant. Upon our arrival, we were a bit early so they recommended we go to Goosecreek Winery- which was very good and our favorite winery during our stay in Napa! We got back and were checked in to a room with a view of the winery and a great fireplace. From the get go, we noticed a slight smell in the bathroom but nothing too offputting so we didn't say anything about it. It was cold and rainy while we were there and every time we left the room, we would come back to find the bathroom cold as someone had opened the window in the shower. I'm guessing the staff knew about the smell and that is why they kept opening our window? I put my suitcase on the right side of the room lining the wall. A few times I went to pick up an item of closing that was falling out of the suitcase and they felt damp. I didn't think anything about it until the 3rd time it happened the morning we left and i realized the entire side of the room was wet all along the carpet. I have a feeling this is why it smelled. We mentioned both of these items upon check out and the front desk staff didn't seem at all surprised or concerned. The first morning we were there (we stayed 2 nights), we went to the work out room- small but everything works well. We kept seeing other guests walk by with food and when I finished working out, I called the front desk to find our where we could go for breakfast. She said there was a complimentary breakfast until 10am that we had just finished. No one mentioned this to us at check in. They were very nice and sent us a tray to our room. The 2nd morning we went to go to the room for breakfast only to walk into a business meeting. Breakfast had been moved which we were told as we were walking out of a meeting we had interrupted. We found it a enjoyed a nice continental breakfast. We went to the workout room next and watched as about 20 hotel guests did the same thing we did- went to the wrong room and they never put up a sign telling anyone that breakfast had moved. This just seemed strange to me and a bit unorganized. There were other things that just seemed a bit off but like I said, I think we just caught the hotel on a bad day(s). The staff was very pleasant and we did really enjoy our stay and loved Yountville!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: JD1586
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge was the perfect place to spend our 10th anniversary trip. It was our first visit to Napa Valley and the incredible staff eagerly arranged much of our agenda in advance. Their familiarity with the area was obvious based upon the suggested wineries, restaurants, and other areas of interest; they never disappointed us. I recommend the Lodge without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Napa!!”
Reviews.Author: Mahoney1219
Reviews.Content: The accommodations, staff, and service were second-to-none during your stay. The staff was delightful and made sure that our every need was met promptly. Moreover the Lodge grounds were designed and landscaped so well we must have taken over 50 pictures to share with friends and family (and use for our own home).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel with Great Views and Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vujie
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family and we loved the free breakfast. The rooms were amazing and the pool is beautiful and a great place to get together with friends and family. The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. The lobby is very nice and enjoyed the afternoon cookies and wine tasting. The staff was very courteous and helpful and went above and beyond to assist my family. Our room was right off the pool and was so peaceful and quiet. Can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Quaint, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emconnelly
Reviews.Content: Great location, very easy to find and convenient to many vineyards and restaurants. Breakfast is included and was very delicious and much more than I expected. The view of the vineyard from my room was amazing. The beds are so comfortable I wish I had one like it at home (along with the linens). The pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. The maid service was impeccable and can't wait to visit again. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we could have stayed longer...”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonFamily
Reviews.Content: We recently took at trip that included 2 nights at The Napa valley lodge and then 3 nights in DT San Francisco. The Napa Valley Lodge was perfect. We enjoyed the quietness of the hotel, the spacious room, great champagne breakfast and the wonderful courtyard. The courtyard was a perfect place to eat our breakfast and to enjoy a glass of wine after touring several wineries. I did not have any complaints about this hotel. The location wass central to all of the area's wineries and attractions. The only wish that we did have is that we would have liked to stay longer..... Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: WineCountryFan76
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Napa Valley Lodge to us for a quick trip we were taking to the area. The Lodge and our room was beautiful, as was our view of the vineyards. The staff was friendly and very helpful. And the location was perfect, affording great access to the wonderful restaurants and wineries of the region. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler6210
Reviews.Content: If your room is on the main highway, don't count on getting any sleep. Everyone owns a truck or motorcycle. Good luck on a view of the vinyards that the web site shows. On the wood burning fireplace, can you say "Duraflame". Same some bucks, not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise & Wine Valley”
Reviews.Author: baruranch
Reviews.Content: We left San Francisco & decided to spend the night in Napa. Yountville was a pleasant surprise. We just happened to locate Napa Valley Lodge and were very pleased with the accommodations and the service. We were given complimentary wine tastings to approx 10 wineries, five of them you could easily walk to from the hotel. We highly recommend Girard Wines. The kids 8 & 12 loved the pool, boce pit and the complimentary breakfast is one of the best we have ever had. I can't wait to be back with just my husband or just girlfriends and stay at least 2 or more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Napa Valley Hotel w/Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: jws427
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a two-night stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. From check-in, when the front desk team (including all-star Nancy) patiently and happily helped to map out our winery itinerary and suggested dining spots, to check out we felt completely taken care of. We stayed in a suite, which was stunning. It was the perfect relaxation spot after a day of wine tasting (and included a fireplace, soaking tub and vineyard views from the balcony - amazing). The location was smack in Yountville and was walking distance to spots like the French Laundry and Bouchon, which made late-night dining all the better as no driving was required. The perfect finishing touch was the breakfast that comes with a stay here. Trays are provided in the dining area, so we were able to load one up and head back to the pool area to enjoy those vineyard views, the pool and fire pit. I couldn't speak highly enough about this hotel and their amazing staff and will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, charming and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Keenan75
Reviews.Content: The room and bath were spacious and comfortable. The bed was especially cozy. Location couldn't be better - close to fantastic wineries and restaurants. Best value in Yountville!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive motel”
Reviews.Author: Kikilalu
Reviews.Content: We wanted a romantic getaway. The pictures of this property are deceiving. It was not an upscale property. Hodgepodge furniture. Some signs of upgrades but still shows its age. I had a king bed with vineyard view. Don't be fooled by this. The patio furniture is old and plastic. The view is of a few rows of vines. Not impressive. Breakfast not great. Walk to Bouchon and eat there instead. Overall, quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and relaxing paradise”
Reviews.Author: NAPAFANS
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to California together as a married couple and while we were spending the majority of our vacation driving up route one and touring the many sites along the way we wanted a few days just to relax, enjoy the beatuiful views of Napa Valley and famous wineries. When we arrived to the Napa Valley Lodge we were awestruck by the gorgeous vineyard views outside of our window and the romantic room that awaited us. We enjoyed the hot tub out under the stars on that cool night in january and then we started a fire in the fireplace to keep cozy that night. It was truly one of the most romantic places we have stayed together as a couple (and we are avid travelers). The "continental" brunch the following day was beyond our expectations. A buffet including every food we could have possibly wanted and more awaited us and once again we ate our breakfast cozily by the roaring fireplace in the dining room. The staff at the front desk were happy to help us chose what wineries we planned to venture out to which was very helpful seeing as how this was our first trip to Napa Valley. They definately steered us in the right direction. Everyone including the cleaning staff could not have been more curteous and happy to be of assistance. We will definately return someday, maybe for an anniversary to relive those relaxing and romantic moments.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Napa Valley Lodge - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Shareee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with a group of friends, at the Napa Valley Lodge, for two nights and had a wonderful time. The location was perfect and close to the wineries as well as within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The rooms and bathroom was spacious and clean, there was a bacony with chairs and the views of the distant mountains and vineyards were beautiful. Because of the size of our party, we stayed in a room with two double beds and a room with a king and fireplace. Both rooms faced the courtyard, the mountains and the pool. The weather was in the low 70's so we didn't try the pool but many people did use the hot tub. Even more special is the fire pit, shown on their web site, where people congregated each evening to stay warm but enjoy the cool, crisp air. Very relaxing after a long day of tasting wines at the various wineries. The hotel is really convenient if you want to walk out to dinner each night. We ate at Bouchon the first night and had a wonderful dinner. It is supposedly owned by the same owners as French Laundry but at a fraction of the price. Excellent meal. The second night, we ate at Tra Vigne, in St Helena -- also excellent. The pasta is delicious and the restarant is beautiful. I'd highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel (reasonable for Napa Valley) in a fabulous location. We enjoyed every minute of our stay and would stay there again the next time in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “upper drawer at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Beezercal01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on a Sunday night after wine tasting, a class at the CIA and dinner at Mustards. We were offered a free upgrade to a room that opened out into a vineyard. The upgrade was the "view" rather than the room itself. For $230 in the wine country, we felt it was an excellent value. The room was spacious with a very large granite fireplace (real wood burning) and a great bathroom. Big comfy bed, huge whirpool tub and large shower. The breakfast was much more generous than any other that I have had that is included with the room and perfectly adequate in a nice breakfast room. The food was fresh, made frm high quality ingrediants and monitored by attentive staff. The only downside was the free wireless internet which had a weak signal and I was unable to connect.. I would have been disappointed with no internet had our stay been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: LOnvacation
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fabulous! The town of Yountville is definitely the place to stay. Walking distance to many 5 star restaurants, shops, and wine tasting rooms. A short drive to all the famous Napa Wineries. Try to reserve a room upstairs (it's quieter) and overlooking the pool. It's quite beautiful.We went for the luxury king suite and were not disappointed. Flat screen t.v, super comfy bed, 2 person tub, fluffy robes, and a fireplace with a Duraflame log. The outdoor pool is heated to 90 degrees so you can enjoy it year round, which we did. The front desk staff were very respectful and helpful with reservations. This was a wonderfully romantic place to get away to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Amenities, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NCelGrande
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the incredibly friendly staff and found the rooms nicely decorated and very comfortable. The champagne breakfast buffet was excellent and the bed was very comfortable. The fitnes center is a bit small, but that was the only negative. NVL is situated within walking distance of many restaurants in Yountville and the grounds are very attractive. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: svetter
Reviews.Content: What we liked best about the Napa Valley Lodge: 1. Walking to Yountville restaurants and shops 2. Incredibly comfy, fluffy beds 3. Beautiful, spacious rooms and especially bathrooms 4. Balconies! Outside time drinking wine and eating cheese. The Lodge was very clean and comfortable. We didn't take advantage of many of the amenities - it was too cold and rainy for the pool, we were out and about during afternoon snacks and Friday wine tastings, and we skipped the hotel breakfast to walk to Bouchon Bakery instead. But, it was an excellent experience, exactly what we wanted for a long weekend in Napa. No complaints here - and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: myrtledee
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, everything about our stay was perfect! Our spacious room was lovely and cozy with a fireplace and view of the vineyards and surrounding hills. The gounds are beautiful and the staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also very nice with a great variety - and good coffee!! Very convenient to walk to any of the great Yountville restaurants. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Basil53
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is close to everywhere you want to be! We walked to dinner at Bouchon! We passed many other great restaurants- French Laundry, Bottega, Ad Hoc- so we had many choices within walking distance. The Napa Valley Lodge has many amenities to enhance your stay, a hot tub, pool, bocce court, warm cookies and tea in the afternoon, fireplaces in the rooms and views of the vineyards. I highly recommend The Napa Valley Lodge as your homebase for exploring Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was hoping...”
Reviews.Author: hmgardner95
Reviews.Content: After two wonderful years living in Boston, I returned to my home of San Francisco and spent one of my first weekends back wine tasting in Napa. We stayed here and it was perfect....welcoming staff, comfortable sitting room with a fireplace, and spacious nice rooms/bathrooms (I might add...wonderful smelling shampoo and conditioner) and an excellent location. This is the perfect place to stay and I will most definitely be staying there again...very soon! Heather Richardson

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and a charming place!”
Reviews.Author: carringtonn
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is in an ideal location in the center of picturesque Yountville. All of the best restaurants (French Laundry, Bouchon, Bottega, Ad Hoc, etc.) and stores are within a few blocks and easily walkable. The hotel itself is quaint and charming with amazing service. Off of the main hotel entryway is a cozy study-like room with a leather couch and chairs around a great fire place. In the afternoon fresh baked cookies are delivered here and tea is served. Total dream! I can't wait for my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in the best town in the Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: EASM
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in the Napa Valley from the time there were few wineries, less places to stay, and basically no good restaurants, except the original French Laundry. Now wineries everywhere, lovely inns, and world-class restaurants have transformed the Valley. We have stayed in many of the lodgings and are thrilled to now be making the the Napa Valley Lodge our resting spot of choice. Location is outstanding: the top of Yountville, providing the opportunity for long walks. The staff is welcoming, friendly, and very accommodating. The rooms are well appointed, spacious, include a lovely fireplace, good closet and drawer space, and (in our case) a balcony with chairs and a table to enjoy a glass of champagne late afternoon or late at night. Breakfast is served daily and includes a wide choice of pastries, breads, cereals, beverages, yoghurts, eggs and fruits: something for every taste. Maid service is thorough and unobtrusive. We have found a lovely "home" in Yountville. :-)

Reviews.Title: “my girlfriend knew about the trip but not that i was going to ask her to marry me!!”
Reviews.Author: wramos13
Reviews.Content: this was not our first stay at NVL. but this will be the most rememberable trip yet. i have been planing this trip to yountville for over 8 months because i have been planing to ask my girlfriend to marry me. during the course of the 8 months i have been talking with Nancy (director of sales) and Beverlee who is Nancy's coworker. these two went above and beyond anything i could ever ask of them. when i told Nancy about my plan to ask Heather (girlfriend) to marry me she went crazy. she started to help me with the planing of where i could ask her and was soooo helpful with every little detail. i also spoke with Beverlee who assisted me with reserving a limo and planing the different wineries to stop at and do some wine tasting. i told Beverlee that heather and i where Cabernet fanatics and Beverlee told that so was she. she immediately started telling me about great Cab wineries. she also filled me in on a winery that only makes Cab.and that it was one that was not well known and not visited often. this winery was THE BEST. not only did i end up proposing to heather there but we got a private tour of their winery by the owners daughter!!!! what winery do you know of that will give you a private tour and have the owners daughter give the tour. Dunn vineyards is the best winery i have ever heard of or seen. Beverlee from napa valley lodge drove over to Dunn vineyards, which is about 25-30 minutes from yountville, and placed candles on the wine barrels in the cavern to make it more romantic for heather. as we pulled up to Dunn Vineyards in the limo Beverlee was pulling out. but luckily heather didn't see. well to say the least, this trip went off with a bang!!! this was all due to two ladies Nancy and Beverlee. this would of been impossible without them. i thank you Napa Valley Lodge for making my engagement better than i could have imagined. if you ever go to Napa. it would be best if you stayed at Napa Valley Lodge. they go above and beyond any expectation you could throw their way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Service, Wonderful Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: sdandphilly
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend visiting the Napa Valley in Dec 2009. As many times as I have visited the Napa Valley, I rarely stay the night there because I only live in San Francisco and its usually a day trip. This time however, becasue we were celebrating an anniversay we decided to make a weekend out of it and saty at the Napa Valley Lodge. Upon arrival, we were immediately checked in and offered to participate the free wine tasting they had happening in the cozy lobby area. Because we were starving, we declined the wine tasting and went straight to dinner at Hurley's in Yountville, which came reccomend by the staff at the Lodge. After dinner we came back to the Hotel and went straight to bed exhausted from the long work week and drive up on Friday night - oh and might I add that the bed was sooooo comfortable that I want want one at home! The next morning we enjoyed a very nice complimentary champagne continental breakfast at the hotel. They offered a nice variety of breakfast foods, coffee, juice and champagne. The hotel had set us up to do a wine tasting at a private family estate - Dunn Vineyards - and printed us out perfect directions on how to get there since neither of us had been. When we arrived, we were able to enjoy some excellent wines and a private tour. Little did I know that our private tour turned out to be in the candlelit caves and it was more than a tour - my boyfriend proposed!! The hotel had been extremely generous to him in helping him set the perfect engagement opportunity. After our contiued day of wine tasting we arrived back at the hotel to a room full of rose petals and champagne on ice waiting for us to enjoy! The hotel staff even helped us (since I wasn't able to get the reservation myself) to get a much sought after table at Bottega - which was also amazing. We were able to make a noce cozy fire in the fireplace in our room and enjoy the evening sipping champagne and celebrating such a happy time for both of us. My fiance couldn't have planned a better weekend and with the help of the Napa Valley Lodge he was able to pull it all off. I would go back in a heartbeat, A) becasue the hotel was amazing, and B) it now holds a very special place in our hearts!

Reviews.Title: “Vineyard Views, cozy fireplace...slept like a princess....”
Reviews.Author: beautyseeker11
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Napa Valley Lodge and again we were thrilled! Some of the highlights: the friendly staff upon check-in, the view from our room of rolling hills and vineyards (our room faced the beautifully appointed courtyard pool/jacuzzi area also), the fireplace was ready to go, creating a cozy atmosphere and the beautiful spa like shower/bathroom was luxurious. The room itself is elegant and the best part, the comfortable bed; I slept like a dream... In the morning we walked (a quick jaunt by foot) into the little town of Yountville after a lovely continental breakfast compliments of our hotel....magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “R&R in Yontville”
Reviews.Author: berghund
Reviews.Content: The weather outside was frightful....We stayed here right before Christmas, on a cold and wet night. Inside the hotel was warm and cozy and the staff's reception and service was equally welcoming and friendly. The fireplace in the room was 'spot on' given the weather, the season and the company. For a romantic getaway in a very quant part of the US you can't beat staying here. It's down the street from some great restaurants and in the middle of some great vineyards.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable luxury”
Reviews.Author: LeighTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent New Year's here, waited until the last minute to make plans and was really pleased with the warm and attentive service we received from our first phone call. The room was spacious with a beautiful view. The breakfast was beautifully presented.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: clm4832
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful corner room that was elegant and cozy and enjoyed the pleasant, helpful staff. This is a great location, surrounded by so many great restaurants and winneries.

Reviews.Title: “All the little details that make this hotel a "must stay" destination!”
Reviews.Author: itango
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for one night in August and absolutely loved it! All the little details that make this place great include: an iPod holder that connects to external speakers with remote, the firelog if you wanted to use the wood-burning fireplace, having the soap and shampoo in the shower already but the lotion on the vanity counter (so when you want to take a shower, you have everything you need and you can use the lotion when you get out), the little towels in the shower in case you get soap or shampoo in your eyes, etc. The location of the NVL to downtown Yountville and its fine restaurants was also convenient. It's a short 5-10 walk, and I went to Michael Chiarello's restaurant when I stayed at NVL. After a great dinner (and amazing wine), I went back to NVL and unwound in the hot tub. They also have a fire pit table, which was very nice. My room had a private balcony with a bistro set, and overlooked a vineyard. Incredibly pictueresque.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: gianfran
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a perfect location in Yountville. Spacious and comfortable rooms with friendly staff. Will Return!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to celebrate our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: wineloverDenver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The location was perfect - we could walk to all the restaurants in town and explore the nearby wineries. The rooms were spacious and updated, the staff made excellent recommendations on where to go, and the hotel property was so charming. We sat by the pool, used the exercise room and enjoyed the champagne breakfast each day. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all my friends/family. What a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kellym9293
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff were friendly. You are located right off the main road but the room was really quiet. Our room overlooked grapevines and had a private deck to enjoy the view! I think the room was a good value! I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Now my favorite place to stay in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: winendine16
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Napa Valley several times and the Napa Valley Lodge is the best by far. I went this time just to relax and enjoy the perfect weather. Upon my arrival, the front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating, My sleeping room was perfect. Fireplace, comfortable bed, and wonderful bathroom. There are fabulous restaurants within walking distance. A small park right across the street should you bring your kids or want to have a picnic. In the evening, there is a fire pit and plenty of comfortable furniture in the courtyard to relax and have a glass of wine. It was a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Again and Again!”
Reviews.Author: SaintFrncs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge several times over the past 3 years for trips to the wine country primarily because of the superior service provided by the staff, especially at reception. The location, amenities and location are excellent as well. I have never had anything but a wonderful experience here, both with my spouse or with friends for a retreat. Even though there are many wonderful places to stay in wine country, I will always choose the Napa Valley Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place with Champagne for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Globewandering
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night.Service excellent at the front desk.Facilities and rooms great,(the i pod player was a nice addition in the room)The breakfast was very good and served in a lovely setting overlooking a vineyard. What you dont see when looking on the internet is that the lodge is next to a freeway,but the noise was minimal. We would go back here,it was all done very well with thoughtful touches. Yountville is expensive to eat in,we had a lovely meal at a local restuarant but it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cozy and relaxing. A wine lovers dream.”
Reviews.Author: Dallaswinegirl
Reviews.Content: We loved this boutique hotel. The view out of our patio was beautiful..we overlooked the pool,outdoor fire pit , and rolling hills of Napa. The linens were 1st class and we enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning out by the pool. Convenient location and friendly staff. We had a leisurely 5 days in Napa. Suggest getting a good map of the wineries..there are over 400 in the area. Enjoyed some great meals. Mustards was the bomb! We can't wait to go back with friends.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Service & Super Clean. I wouldn't stay anywhere but here from now on!”
Reviews.Author: xoblondeqt143xo
Reviews.Content: So, we ended up staying here for one night because the first night we stayed somewhere that was majorly below standards. This place was beyond fabulous!!! It had a cute little courtyard where the pool is located. They even had a place to fill up water & a mini fireplace. The cost was reasonable & definitely worth it! The room was unbelievably clean. My boyfriend and I both agreed that we will NEVER stay anywhere else but here when we travel to Napa. :) Perfect location to great restaraunts and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elpesto
Reviews.Content: We came up to Napa for a special birthday party in Geyserville, and just to relax for a few days. Napa Valley Lodge was very easy to locate, and despite its proximity to Hwy 29, it was very quiet and peaceful. The staff at the front desk were very accommodating and pleasant, anxious to make our stay as relaxing and comfortable as possible. There was ample parking close to the room. The suite itself was very nicely appointed, with a fireplace and a private deck with a beautiful view across the valley. The finish work in the bathroom was world class. The pool area was quiet and included a firepit, which very nice in the cool Napa evenings. The common room was spacious and the breakfast service was unique and delicious. We did not use the fitness room, but from what I could see it was on par with the rest of the Lodge. Apparently every effort had been made to qualify the Napa Valley Lodge as the best accommodation in Yountville. I would recommend this property to anyone interested in a relaxing and convenient Napa getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good.... but not Great”
Reviews.Author: beejturner
Reviews.Content: We booked this for the purpose of a 4:00 wedding and asked for an early check-in which we were told would be no problem. When we arrived, the room wasn't done, nor were there any notes about our early arrival. The room was nice - but nothing spectacular. The bathrooms are the nicest feature of the room. It's basically a very nice motel. The location is great in Yountville, and it was clean and somewhat friendly. Just nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tripperPortland
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous room overlooking a vineyard. The hotel staff at front desk went the extra mile for us.
