My wife needed yogurt at 6:30 am before dining room was open and staff got it for her.Wine tasting at 5 pm featured a great napa winery. Location is in heart of Napa Valley. All in all our weekend could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Average overpriced hotel masquerading as a luxury Napa Valley retreat”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge in August '08 for a few nights on our first visit to the Napa Valley. At that time there were no discounts available and so we paid the full rack rate of $345 (plus taxes) per night. Although not exactly cheap, we wanted to stay in Yountville for the restaurants and so we paid a premium for the location; plus the fact that the property gets good reviews on TA swayed our decision to stay there. The rooms were quite large, the bed was comfortable and the bathrooms were nice; and we also had a nice view of the neighbouring vineyard from our small balcony. We enjoyed spending a few hours recovering from a hard days wine tasting next to the pool, soaking up the late afternoon sunshine. However we were always conscious of the roads next to the property, as it's just off Highway 29, and our room was at the end of the property right next to Washington St. Not that we were really bothered by the road noise, but we were aware of it, especially in the morning; or when we were sitting out on the balcony. The property is a converted motel, and so keeps a number of motel features and ambience such as being able to park outside the rooms. We actually found this fairly convenient, but I can imagine that this would not be to everyones tastes, as the property does seem a bit soulless, and lacks any real charm compared to other Napa Valley options. The champagne breakfast was an average breakfast buffet. Although it has to be said that we were either driving, or we had plans to visit wineries so we didn't feel like starting the day with champagne and so didn't try that. We also didn't book any spa treatments. We really didn't see that many staff during our stay, and so we didn't have much interaction with the staff other than check-in/out, and also because the in-room free wi-fi wasn't working (and never got fixed). The staff were perfectly professional, but not exactly warm and friendly, and certainly didn't put in any effort to introduce themselves or make our stay special in any way. We didn't receive any of the little touches mentioned in other reviews: No wine tasting passes, recommendations, offer of help with reservations, wine tasting, bottle of wine, nothing. When we took a stroll into town for our dinner reservations at Redd, we walked past The Vintage Inn and Villagio, and after a quick look around we decided that if we ever came back to Yountville that we'd try one of those properties instead. Overall we felt that for the prices charged the hotel could have done a lot more, and that they only justify their rates due to their Yountville location (there are better located options in town). But we didn't see fit to complain, or even write a negative review on TA, because we loved the Napa Valley so much, we didn't feel that an overpriced, ordinary hotel, which we didn't ever intend to spend a lot of time at had spoiled our trip. Had this review ended here, we'd be giving the Napa Valley Lodge 3/5 and possibly not writing much of a review. but we enjoyed our first trip to the Napa Valley so much we have arranged to go back this year. We also wanted to go back to Yountville to try some of the other great restaurants in September at crush time. We originally looked to make a booking in March at either The Vintage Inn, or Villagio, but their websites showed no availability for the dates we wanted. So after further investigation the only place in town showing availability was the Napa Valley Lodge. As the only available option I reluctantly went ahead and booked it. Again this time there were no discounted rates available, but I wasn't exactly surprised by that as it was peak season, and everywhere else was already full. However I kept checking back from time to time, and in July I discovered that not only were most Yountville hotels now showing availability for the dates we wanted, many of them, including the Napa Valley Lodge, were now offering discounted rates for those dates. I contacted the NVL and asked them to change our reservation for the discounted rate, so that I wouldn't need to cancel and rebook. Their reservations department flat out denied that the discounted rate was available, and told me I was mistaken. So I contacted them again, and this time I proved that the rate was available by providing them a series of screenshots from their own website. They then reluctantly backed down and amended my reservation to the lower rate. Also as this time we are visiting in September, we have been advised that popular restaurants and wineries book up well in advance and so it's advisable to make advanced reservations. So I made contact with the concierge at NVL to ask their assistance and advice in making some reservations for some wineries and restaurants. As we live in the UK, the time difference and international call rates means it's a lot easier for us to communicate with the West Coast by email; the concierge at NVL was incredibly slow, not really helpful and had to be chased to do anything (despite being exceptionally quick to respond to our initial email). I should point out that we don't want an overly planned itinerary and weren't asking for a lot of difficult reservations (such as the French Laundry, or tiny out of the way wineries) we were requesting one restaurant reservation, and 2 or 3 tasting reservations for well known wineries yet it would take weeks for them to respond. This time we are also staying at a few other Napa Valley locations, and so I had made contact with their concierge departments for similar purposes. They all eclipsed the NVL, were helpful and didn't need to be reminded or chased; despite the fact that in some cases the properties charge significantly lower rates. In the end I got fed up with the lack of customer service shown by the staff at the Napa Valley Lodge, and despite the fact that it cost a cancellation fee to do so (why exactly?? When the cancellation was more than a month before the check-in date), I cancelled the reservation and made a booking elsewhere in Yountville. I get the impression that the staff at the Napa Valley Lodge don't really enjoy their jobs, and that hospitality certainly does not come naturally to them. It seems to me that customers are seen as an opportunity to make money, and they are treated as such. As a place to sleep; a base for the great restaurants in town, and to be centrally located for the wineries it's OK (Get a discounted rate, never pay full price as it's just not worth it). But as a luxury hotel, justifying the rates it charges, and offering guests an unforgettable wine country experience it fails miserably.

Reviews.Title: “So Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lmdicke
Reviews.Content: This was such a nice 2 days of relaxation. Everything was flawless. For example on Fri night when I checked in there was a complimentary wine tasting in the lobby. This was not just some give away wine, but a very special boutique (2,000 cases/year) winery. I tried 2 superb varietals. All this is just to demonstrate that everything about the NVL is first class. I'll return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In All Respects”
Reviews.Author: TRFloyd
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Napa Valley Lodge. It exceeded expectations in all respects. The location is close to most of the Napa Valley wineries and fine restaurants. And the rooms are impeccably clean, well appointed and have all the latest upgrades (eg. flat screens, ipod docks, etc.) The property itself is very nice, and the daily continental breakfast is incredibly well done and a nice amenity. The staff is very friendly. We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Napa Valley, and can highly recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: wine4et
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night, walking distance to all restaurants in town, we had a king room with fireplace, very modern and clean. Room overlooked the courtyard and pool. Excellent breakfast buffet with champagne. Would stay their again. I bboked through travel zoo and saved 100 from hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing how a quick trip can become a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: norcalparrothead
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to turn a work assignment into a quick get-away. We had about 36 hours to spend in the Napa Valley, and he'd need to work for 3 of them. We reserved a room at the Napa Valley Lodge, last minute, through Travelzoo. At $179, it included wine tasting passes and breakfast. It ended up being a worthwhile package. The package stated, during the reservation process, that we had a choice of 2Q or 1 K bed. I requested K, and when we received the confirmation, it showed 2 Q. The night before arrival, I called the hotel to check on the possibility of a K, and found out that the Travelzoo package mis-stated the options for the package price. The receptionist was VERY kind and moved us into a King fireplace room at no extra charge, as one was available. She also noted my request for no feathers in the bedding. We arrived much earlier than check-in time, and hoped to just get our tasting coupons so that we could enjoy our only day in the valley. The receptionist was happy to put us in a different room than we were originally booked in, since it was already made up. This gave us the chance to use the wi-fi and map out our wine tastings. After that we headed out for the day and enjoyed tasting at 4 wineries. The coupons we used (3) saved us about $45 in tasting fees (the coupons were buy-one-get-one). Napa has become VERY expensive if you want to taste good wine, and you must buy 2 bottles in or order for ONE tasting fee to be waved. I find this disheartening. Upon returning to the hotel, I realized that the bedding we had was probably not feather-free. I checked in at the front desk, and they had already realized the problem, but were waiting for us to return to fix it. The head housekeeper and manager came in and changed out our bedding very quickly and politely. They also delivered our included bottle of wine,and the front desk made our reservation for dinner. We relaxed on our patio, watching the sun sink in the sky over the vineyards. The grounds at the hotel are lush and beautiful. The noise from the highway was unremarkable. We were sitting outside during rush-hour time, and barely noticed the cars. Weekends could be different, I suppose. Later, we had dinner at the Rutherford Grill, and enjoyed one of the bottles of wine we had purchased (they never charge corkage!). The food was fabulous. We enjoyed a fire in our room that evening, and the next morning, breakfast was very nice. It's continental, but had a wide assortment of choices. The power went out in the entire valley that morning, but we managed to have a nice breakfast anyway... the room was well-lit with natural light. We were very sorry to have to leave, and regretted not having time to enjoy the pool or the beautiful firepit. We'll have to return again to do that. All in all, we found the room, hotel, and service to be excellent, and will definitely return, and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most romantic spots I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: carwheat
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time as did my wife. The hotel was as beautiful as the surrounding scenery. Our room and the grounds were immaculate, and staff at the front desk were very pleasant. We took advantage of their complimentary breakfast in the morning. I got together a tray of food and took it back to my wife in our room. As for dining the previous evening we did not go to any restaurants (although I have dined at Bouchon before and greatly enjoyed it.) Instead we got a couple of loaves of bread from Bouchon bakery and some French cheese from the market down Washington st. a bit. I must highly recommend the truffled salami that the market carries. We then dined in our room enjoying the view of the vineyard and the gradually darkening sky. All and all it was a great place to be on our 5th wedding anniversary and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, gorgeous poolside area, nice room (esp bathroom) makes up for minor glitches.”
Reviews.Author: medset
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 2 nights here. We booked with Travelzoo, which had a $179 special for the most basic rooms. We stayed in the slightly nicer $199 king size bed/work desk/vineyard view from our vineyard-view patio room. The positives: the grounds are beautiful, pool is very nice and clean, rooms are good, bathrooms are outstanding. The biggest compliment we can pay to the hotel is that we came her to taste wine but we ended up buying a few bottles right off the bat and then lollygagging around the hotel for the majority of our stay. The hotel was nice enough to take two wine drinkers out of the wine tasting game, woith no regrets. The negatives, which are minor in comparison: on the first day here, we tried the shower multiple times, and we got lukewarm water at best. In fairness to the hotel, we ttried showering after 10am so the early shower crew had already had done their damage on the hot waer supply. Later on, the hot water returned. The water pressure is low, but that could be due to conservation efforts so not a big deal. The second issue related to breakfast the first day. Again, we came during the second hour of breakfast but the offerings at that time were paltry at best. The second day was much better so perhaps this was a unique situation. We are in our 30s but, if you are relatively young like us and like good food that is fresh and not too pretentious, try Ad Hoc. The meal we had was very, very good and the whole vibe of the restaurant is very youthful.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly comfortable and pictureque place to spend a night”
Reviews.Author: zanker
Reviews.Content: Based on various reviews, we weren't sure whether to expect a glorified motel or something special. Luckily, it was the latter. We were able book the rooms at reasonable rates online with short notice and we were upgraded upon check-in. I don't know what the experience of a standard twin room would be like but if you can ask and get a first floor room looking out to the adjacent vineyard, that would be ideal. Although the front of the building does look like a well-maintained roadside motel, the inside and experience is very different. About five steps away from our patio sliding door were rows of vines just sprouting small grapes with the sun setting in the background. I've stayed in 5 star hotels in Napa that didn't have a view this nice and this close to what the wine region is all about. The bathroom was well done. Certainly high-end quality. The bed was comfortable. The front desk staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. The complementary bottle of wine and a working fireplace add to the great experience. Some of the best restaurants in the region are a 10 minute walk down the street. Since I was the designated driver of the group, it was nice to be able to enjoy a bottle of wine with dinner and not have to drive back to our hotel. French Laundry, Buchon, Bottega are all nearby. Before you leave in the morning, I'd recommend stopping by Jessup for wine tasting with cheese about 5 minutes walk down the street. Overall, everyone in our group of 4, staying in two different rooms in adjacent buildings, were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Get reservations in writing and don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: DDAVOUST
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online, but called to make our reservation over the phone because we wanted three of their packages. Right from the start, we were a little concerned when the hotel staff asked us to tell them what their web site said. It took several calls to finally book what we wanted including a balloon flight, a winery tour and massage treatments. We were told that the details of the winery tour and massage treatments would be set up when we got to the hotel. We gave them our credit card and thought we were all set. Our big surprise came when we arrived at the hotel and were told that they had no record of us. I checked my email right from the hotel lobby and only then realized that they had never sent me a confirmation. The front desk staff essentially accused us of lying about having a reservation. They also said that the winery tour and massages should have been set up in advance, which shows that their phone staff is really poorly trained. Anyway, the front desk staff did make us arrangements to stay at another hotel for the first night since they were booked and did set up the winery tour for the next day. We also found out that you can get a $179 per night rate on TravelZoo.com. The person helping us told us it would be better to separate out our packages and pay the TravelZoo rate plus the separate costs of the services. (This actually turned out to cost us more, but not by much). Some rooms in the hotel do actually look out onto a vineyard and our room was one of those. Unfortunately, the bed was uncomfortable and so we asked to be moved to another room the second night, which cost us the view. Some other reviewers said it was noisy, because 29 runs right by the hotel, but we did not notice any noise. The pool area is probably the highlight of the hotel. It is very private and has an outdoor fire pit that seems to go year round. We did enjoy that part. Overall, though, I would say the hotel was a disappointment. I donâ€™t know where we will stay next visit to Napa, but I donâ€™t think it will be the Napa Valley Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice play to stay...”
Reviews.Author: birdeeking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a trip to San Fran, with the last two days/nights in Napa Valley. We picked the Napa Valley Lodge just off of other reviews we read. This was our first trip to Napa. I must say it was alittle different than I envisioned.... Ok first about this area. It took about an hour and a half to get their from the San Fran airport. When you get over the bay area, the view is unbelievable; mountains and valleys and grape vines for as far as the eye can see.. I was just alittle surprised that the napa lodge was literally right off the main road , st rt 29. I pictured a place deeper in the mountain area or more secluded. Its not bad where its located, just different than I pictured. It looks very spanish looking from the outside, not at all like a best western. I read alot about the great service, and was alittle disapointed with our treatment at check inn. You can imagine being in a car for nearly two hours, and wanting to use the bathroom and just get your stuff out of your car.. Well although it was nearly 3pm, the girl at the front desk, just said to come back in an hour.. we had to ask for a pool card to look around and use the restrooms... The girl took our credit card and we filled out all the paperwork, then when we came back in about two hours, I asked the same girl if our room was ready, and she forgot us completely. She started asking me to fill out the same paperwork. When I told her she already took it down, she questioned me if it was her that I went to... She lost the paperwork, made me fill it out again, and then when we walked to our room, and by the way, no bell hop for bags and our room was on the second floor with no elevators so you have to carry your bags up, anyways, the girl called my room and again asked for my credit card number because it didnt come out... The only reason I mentioning the above is because some people raved about the service. You can tell ours was disapointing... But lets talk about the room; It was fantastic. It was spacious, and awesome bathroom. We used the fireplace,and the terrace...We loved the view on the second floor of the grapes...so I definetly would say to stay there... The area is close by to some nice shops and restaurants.. be prepared for some steep prices for food and some menu's that need translation. All in all, a great place to stay ....enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, upscale yet unpretentious, my wife and I loved our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Carlos088
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Napa Valley Lodge over July 4th weekend for the first time in 8 years and we were very impressed by the tasteful, subtle changes to the property, from the bache ball court to the spa treatment area to the fireplace by the pool. The rooms are very nice -- ours had a great outdoor deck with a view of Napa Valley, and our children enjoyed the pool. It goes without saying that the property's location in the center of Yountville gives you instant access to all of the great restaurants and wineries within minutes. There were a mix of families with children and couples getting away, and this is one of the rare places that seems equally appropriate for both a family getaway and a couples retreat. I would also be remiss to not add that the service was very friendly and helped us coordinate babysitters for our children. My wife and I have stayed at many different hotels in Napa and Sonoma and highly recommend the Napa Valley Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Steps away from the French Laundry, No better location in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: newvi
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe it when we found this absolutely delightful hotel next to the French Laundry when we came for our anniversary. Loved the locale. We walked down Washington Street everyday to do wine tasting and experience Yountville's culinary delights. Hotel was beautiful, pool was spectacular and even the breakfast first class.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the other reviews, do whatever you can to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Melanie17Seattle
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our visit to the Napa Valley Lodge. It had everything we could have hoped for..a great, very warm pool, fitness room, large rooms with great bathrooms, and a bed with pillows to die for. Everything in this hotel is well thought out and planned for your enjoyment and relaxation. We had a wonderful, romantic getaway here and loved it's convenience to the local wineries and restaurants. It's the perfect location and a great setting...that being said, I didn't pay 450 per night and I'm not sure I would pay that price. I paid less than half of that and felt like I got an amazing deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, easy, well-located”
Reviews.Author: Seidnerd
Reviews.Content: This hotel, from the outside, looks kind of like a Best Western. We had what was the most or close to the most economical room at $355 a night, which for this area, is very well-priced, but the outside doesn't look like a $355 a night hotel. The lobby is very Best Western-ish but the rooms were not only HUGE but also very, very nice and comfortable. This place is in a GREAT location, right next to the Silverado Trail, off the main highway (and it is true....the rooms are very quiet) and at one end of Yountville, a charming town. Their pool area is very pretty and nicely done. We liked this place and were very comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic hotel nestled in the vineyards of Napa”
Reviews.Author: Deanna9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December for my birthday weekend. We had a beautiful room with the vineyards right outside our sliding glass doors! Additionally, we had a fireplace and very comfortable bed. The staff even gave me a bottle of wine for my birthday. They could not have been friendlier or more helpful. It is also located by numerous restaurants and wineries. Another example of their excellent customer service...we went back to Napa in Feb with our kids and in-laws and our rental car had a flat tire. We pulled into the gas station across the street to change the tire and walked back to the NVL to see if we could use the restrooms. I explained the situation and that we had just stayed there a couple months ago, not only did we get to use the restrooms, but the staff made hot chocolate for my kids!! We loved the hotel in December, but were even more enamoured in Feb!!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis amongst the vineyards”
Reviews.Author: LivetoServe
Reviews.Content: I had the distinct pleasure of staying at the Napa Valley Lodge earlier this month and loved every minute of it. The location is ideal for experiencing all that Napa Valley and Yountville has to offer. Surrounded by both vineyards and a family friendly park, the hotel is ideally situated a short stroll from the French Laundry and other world class restaurants. You can experience the culinary wonders of Yountville without dealing with the traffic, both pedestrian and automobile, that the downtown hotels have to contend with. The inner courtyard is guest-only and is a true sanctuary with bocce ball court, fountains, and a pool. It provides a great location to unwind after a day of wine tasting. Infact, sipping wine just relaxing at night in front of the firepit was a perfect ending to my day. My two hour spa treatment was pure heaven as well. I have experienced many massages at many world class spa resorts and the massage and facial I had at Napa Valley Lodge were the best I have ever had. Ever! Cudos to them! Every single staff member I met was friendly without being overly familiar and were the perfect ambassadors for Napa Valley hospitality. They all seemed to genuinely enjoy working there and helping others. I also found my room to be very comfortable, very large and well appointed. It was also a great value. I have stayed at other hotels in Yountville and I can honestly say that the Napa Valley Lodge has a fan for life in me. Well done and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place to stay in the Napa Valley!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: toddbfromnd
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Trip Advisor and after traveling all over Napa Valley I can say that this has to be the best location possible to stay. If you love wine and food you can not do any better than this place. This is the meca for good food and every place you want to eat at is within about five blocks. After a day of wine tastings you go back to your room and have about a two minute drive to all of the best places to eat in the Napa Valley. I found that everything is north of the town of Napa so you do want to stay in Yountville. Elizabeth is at the front desk and she is like one stop shopping for anything you would like to do threre be it eat, drink, or golf. She made the trip perfect. The courtyard is perfect with the firepit, pool, and hotub. You can drive yourself crazy reading reviews so take my word for it that this is the perfect place to stay!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service & beautiful, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: kkg
Reviews.Content: I just spent last weekend with friends in Yountville and the Napa Valley Lodge ... and I want to go back! The Napa Valley Lodge is in a perfect location within walking distance to all that Yountville has to offer. The service was spot-on. Upon check-in, the front desk worked to get us a reservation at Bottega, a new restaurant and hard to get table in Napa. They were incredibly friendly and accommodating. The lobby was beautiful and cozy with just the right touches from the fireplace to the chocolate chip cookies. The room was clean and newly renovated with a flat screen TV, ipod dock and beautiful bathroom. We also had a great deck with views of the pool, fire-pit and surrounding Napa hills. The property also includes a hot tub and gym. Although, we skipped the gym in lieu of wine tasting at nearby Girard and Jessup Cellars! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Lodge is Beautiful, Clean, and Great service!”
Reviews.Author: susanlchambers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodget last weekend which is in the adorable town of Yountville. Napa Valley Lodge is right in the heart of Yountville and you can walk to all the great local restaurants. The staff is very down to earth, kind and engaging. The rooms are clean, newly renovated with beautiful views of the Napa hills. The pool area is very relaxing again with beautuful views and a quaint atmosphere. There is a fun bocce ball dirt field to play on as well as a full gym. I would recommend this place to anyone going to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: dengle0687
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge last week. The Lodge has some beautiful, well maintained grounds with a nice pool and terrific outdoor, gas fireplace. A nice spot to sit around at the end of the day or in the morning with your coffee. The fitness center looked very nice and I understand there's a spa on the property. The front desk staff were very friendly and upgraded one of our rooms to a suite free of charge. They also worked hard to make sure we were in quiet rooms away from the pool, which was much appreciated. My parents suite and my room were both very clean, had nice flat screen televisions, ipod docks, balconies or patios (depending on which floor you're on) and wonderful, big bathrooms. The Lodge itself is situated very well in Yountville. About a five minute walk to French Laundry and just a few minutes further to Bouchon or Bistro Jeanty. Across the street from a bike rental shop and a park with a swingset and jungle gym. The breakfasts could definitely be improved upon. There wasn't much selection and it was pretty picked over by the time 9:30 rolled around. That's our only complaint though (and it's a pretty small one).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lodge in the Heart of Wine Country!”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took a trip to Napa and stayed at the NVL. The lodge is beautiful and is perfectly perched on Madison and Washington street close to some of the best wineries and restaurants in Napa. Attention to detail is found throughout the rooms. From the beautifully tiled showers to the lavender buds when you walk in, you can't help but relax! Now grab a glass of your favorite red wine and sit outside near the wood burning firepit. A stones through from Opus One, Cakebread, Far Niente, etc and just down Washington Street is some of the best eating in the valley! The breakfast at NVL is wonderful, and you can sit by the pool and enjoy the breathtaking Napa weather. Be sure to walk down the street to Bouchon Bakery, Napa Valley Grill, and Hurley's. The rooms are spacious and ours had a wood burning fireplace. The staff at NVL are friendly and very helpful. Both recommendations we received for dinner were excellent. If you want a great place to stay that won't break your pocketbook, NVL is THE place. We will definitely be coming back soon! Mike and Addy White, Memphis, TN.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: gio23
Reviews.Content: WOW, WOW, WOW, what a pleasant surprise! If you have the opportunity to spend a night or two here do not pass it up. The staff is outstanding and knowledgeable not to mention friendly as can be. The location is perfect for visiting the various wineries. A++

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverWestwind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NVL for 6 nights mid-March. We were more than pleased with our king room on the second floor of the hotel. The room was very spacious, clean, modern, with a wood-burning fireplace that we lit each evening. The bathroom was recently remodelled with slate and marble, it was large, with a huge shower and separate make-up area. Breakfast was ok - a bit boring, so we ate at Bouchon Bakery, and the Model Bakery in St. Helena as well. We had surprisingly good weather while there (in the mid-70's), and sat by the pool in the afternoons. The pool area is beside the vineyard, beautifully landscaped, there is a fire-pit close by that is lit in the evenings. The hotel is very close to all of the wonderful restaurants in Yountville (we highly recommend Bottega, Bouchon and Redd!). For the price we paid (hotel web special), the NVL was great value. We probably would not stay there again if the rate was higher than what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: greyhoundmom24
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Napa Valley Lodge and each time has been great. The staff is always very helpful. It is a nice touch that they call you a short time prior to your trip to see if you need any help with dinner reservations or reservations with any other items in the area. When we arrived, the front desk clerk was very welcoming and helpful and she provided us with a map of the wineries in the area. We booked the Deluxe King Fireplace room which is very spacious. In the room, was a complimentary bottle of wine as well as some coupons for wineries in the area. Our room had a balcony looking out on the pool, wood burning fireplace and a nice tiled shower. Room was clean, bed was comfy! It was nice to have a fire at night after a day out at wine tastings/dinner/etc. Their pool was heated and clean (although we didn't use it this time) and they have a hot tub. There is also a firepit that they light each night where you can sit out and enjoy on a nice Napa evening. In the morning, there is a continental breakfast buffet which had a nice selection of breads, cereal, muffins, fruit, coffee, tea, and even mimosas! Hotel is walking distance or a short drive to great restaurants in Yountville (Bouchon Bakery and Ad Hoc being our favorites!). It is also very central to many wineries and other restaurants in the area. It was another great stay - and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accommodations and service. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Nsilva23
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Napa Valley Lodge was wonderful. The location is incredibly convenient. It is close to wonderful restaurants and many lovely wineries. It also offers great spa services. The room was beautiful and spacious. I particularly enjoyed relaxing one evening, with wine I had purchased earlier, at the outdoor fire pit. Also the champagne brunch succeeded expectations. As a person who works in the wine industry, and is often in Napa tasting at many different wineries, I plan to make any of my future stays at this fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Motel--but nice”
Reviews.Author: TripsPlease
Reviews.Content: Driving up to the hotel was a bit of a shock given that it seems like just any other roadside motel, but we were pleasantly surprised by the friendly and helpful service at check-in and the size of the room. PROS: Plenty of space in the room; clean; comfortable beds; well laid out bathroom with room for two people to get ready at once; free internet access in room; helpful staff; location is close to the many excellent restaurants in Yountville; adequate complimentary breakfast. CONS: PRICE! Anywhere but Napa this hotel would be about $150/night max. We paid $229/night and when my boyfriend asked if they offer a AAA discount (which most hotels do) they said they do not participate in that and that we had already gotten a very good rate (really?). Also, the shower is so lame that getting the shampoo out of your hair will take ages--if you can get it out at all. Big problem. Overall, it's not worth the price but you are kind of hostage to ridiculous hotel rates in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, though a little full of itself”
Reviews.Author: Lit-traveler
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we were surprised to find a drive-up, two-building complex that resembles a glorified motel. But the owners have dressed it up well, with pleasant landscaping and some very handsome materials inside and out. Our large room, with king-size bed, had a fireplace and a lovely outdoor patio overlooking vineyards (though the clothes closet was inexplicably placed inside the bathroom). There's a beautiful pool area with a reasonably large pool (an increasing rarity), a hot tub that's actually hot, and an outdoor gas fireplace at night. Free winetastings are offered some evenings by local wineries. An excellent breakfast buffet, with a wide variety of baked goods and fruit, is served in a handsome meeting room overlooking grapevines. The Lodge's location in the mid-valley town of Yountville--itself a combination of surviving old-fashioned charm and newfangled dining-mecca chic--is quiet. We had brought our bicycles, and it was easy to ride right out our door to beautiful destinations up and down the Napa Valley (avoid busy Hwy. 29 and opt for parallel Silverado Trail--it's far more atmospheric whether you're driving or cycling, with less traffic). If I have a criticism of this hotel, it's with rather high prices given the service and overall "feel." The front desk managed to be both smiling and unhelpful when it counted. We routinely had to wait for clerks' phone conversations to end before we were helped (in one case, the clerk was having a heated phone debate about other employees' work hours). Though the hotel was almost empty during our stay, we were refused a late check-out "because the system won't let me do it" (are the human employees mere pawns in the control of an evil computer?). But the housekeeping staff were friendly, and the rock-hard foam pillows on our otherwise very comfortable bed were happily replaced with down pillows when we asked. At $175 a night, instead of $258, Napa Valley Lodge might seem fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay in Yountville!”
Reviews.Author: emjune10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for a business trip. The staff is wonderful and very accommodating. The guestrooms are very spacious with beautiful bathrooms and fireplaces. The outdoor pool/spa area is fantastic with a great fire pit where you can enjoy a glass of wine. The lodge also provides a great champagne brunch every morning. The hotel is in the perfect location to enjoy everything the valley has to offer. Yountville has many of the best restaurants in the country. Bistro Jeanty, Bouchon and Hurley's are my favorites. This is best the deal in the valley. I am heading back in a couple weeks. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Just a motel, not a lodge”
Reviews.Author: textrav1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay for my husband's birthday. Don't let the pictures fool you, it is definitely not a lodge, it is just a glorified motel. We chose NVL because it received the best reviews. The staff was very pleasant on the phone and in person until we were checking out and wanted them to be aware of some problems we had. Yes, the bathrooms are nice, but no tubs...just showers. And since you can't relax in your tub you would expect you would do that in the hot tub. No, the hot tub was out of order. When I mentioned to Elisabeth that we should have at least been told that the hot tub was not working and that is when she informed me they are not telling anyone because the part has been ordered for two weeks and should be getting it anytime. Point taken, but when you come someplace thinking you will get to use amenities you normally don't use at home, you should be made aware of it. We had problems with the internet all weekend long. They had to reset the router numerous times and send cords to our room to hook-up that didn't fit. The pictures of the rooms show couches and nice furniture, whereas the rooms actually have no couches and wicker chairs and a bakers room for a desk. Finally, when we were checking out you have the option to checkout using your television...that also, was not working. The breakfast was nice for a continental breakfast and the location was great. Would we stay here again, no! The room was decent, but for what we paid, we expected a whole lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: KandG2009
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely phenomenal place to stay. We arrived at the Napa Valley Lodge after hiking in Yosemite for several days and were immediately immersed in pure luxury. The room had a spacious bathroom, fireplace, books on local vineyards, and a very comfortable bed. There was attention to every possible detail. The staff at the front desk assisted us in planning our wine tasting excursions and dinners, and we attended a complimentary wine tasting session at the lodge where we had a chance to meet other guests. I can't imagine a better place to stay for a visit to Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but more Motel than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JB21
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews on Tripsadvisor before I booked this hotel and I have to say that while some are accurate (ie those that compare it to a motel) some were very inaccuarate. To begin with this place is not a lodge or even a hotel but a very good motel. The rooms are directly off the carpark (regardless of which room you have) and while they are clean and spacious they aren't what i would describe as lodge like. Also surprisingly (given that it was sunny when we were there) the rooms were very dark. The breakfast (which is included in your rate) was a basic cold buffet in a drafty room with no service. While I'm sure in summer this is more appealing as you can sit by the pool, in winter its just a bit too simple. Overall we thought that the location was good, the rooms clean, the service (ie recrption) fine but there was no character or warmth to the Hotel and for the money they were charging I think you could find better places. Personally, when I go back to Napa I'll be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Motel with very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Honu_Ohana
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a good stay. However, our impression of the property was that it was basically a motel with very good rooms...the housekeeping staff were friendly, but overall the place was understaffed. This was over New Years, which apologists will probably use as why we did not quite have the warm, "lodge-like" experience we'd expected. However, I point out that a holiday with enough occupancy such that we could not get an early checkin (housekeeping was unable to get a room cleaned between 12 and 3 PM) warrants more staff. When we arrived at 11 am, there was one person at the desk, who handled room service calls, reservation calls, us, and other guests. She had a lot to juggle, but took our phone number to call us if a room became available. Later that afternoon, when we came back at 3 in hopes of a room, there was a different person at the desk, who was unaware of our arrival or that we'd asked for early checkin. The day we left, same juggling of things by the sole person on duty. I note this just in case a reader is expecting a Ventana (Big Sur) type pamepering by staff. Not assured. On the other hand, the deluxe fireplace room was excellent, clean, modern. I'd trade off warm fuzzies from staff for this level of comfort and cleanliness. My caveat is that they really MEAN IT when they say you cannot use the heat/fan when the fireplace is burning. As a result, the room was unleated and chilly until the fake log had burned out. If we come again, I'd skip the fireplace in wintertime, for that reason. We were in a room with a lovely view of vinyards (see pictures). The pool and jacuzzi area are inviting, but it was too cold and rainy to use them. Breakfast is pleasant and ample (cold buffet). The location is excellent--walking distance to resturants and shops, short drives to the best wineries. I'd stay again--good price ($259 on a holiday) for the great room--with adjusted expectations for the staffing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean property, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: luxnomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NVL on the last leg of our West Coast trip during which we slept in six different properties ranging from a ranch to five star experiences. NVL was at par with the best of them for service, cleanliness, location and amenities. Our adjoining rooms were in the new block with views towards the vineyards and lush hills. The sound insulation in the rooms were perfect and the beds were fantastic, all great for a good night's sleep. The rooms are in excellent decorative order and very generous in size with beautiful marble shower-rooms. The book shelves with old print classics complimented the i-pod dock and the art work on the walls were relevant to the setting but restrained. The complimentary breakfast is a modest but earnest affair, clean and ample, sets you up for the day. Excellent property at an excellent location; probably the best value we had on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Napa-Yountsville”
Reviews.Author: JCH75
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for the Thanksgiving holiday. Upon our arrival, we received a very warm, friendly greeting from the staff and manager. The property itself was beautiful and meticulously maintained. We stayed in the Bella Vista Suite which was perfectly cleaned and well appointed including a fireplace. The room also had a great view of the vines, good linens, quality bath products and a superb bathroom. From the very beginning they made transportation arrangements, restaurant reservations, entrÃ©e suggestions and so much more. Every recommendation made by the staff was spot-on. Most importantly, they did it graciously and even followed up to ensure we were always satisfied. At times, they made us feel as we were the only guests in the hotel. Overall, it was perfect from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gearup
Reviews.Content: We could not resist slipping off to the Napa Valley Lodge for a few days after visiting family in the Bay Area. Yountville has some of the top restaurants (French Laundry among others) in the area and is a very quaint city. The Napa Valley Lodge location is excellent, just a short walk to the center of town but far enough away from the activity to offer a quiet setting. The staff was friendly and the recently remodeled room was perfect, comfortable bed, soft sheets plus a gorgeous shower/bathroom. The pool, fire pit and surrounding grounds were the ideal setting for a glass of wine in the evening. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Carhouse
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed the most relaxing and comfortable stay at the Napa Valley Lodge this past weekend. The staff were outstanding, accommodating, kind and paid great attention to every detail of our stay. The rooms were elegantly appointed, the bathrooms were beautiful and the beds and linens plush and luxurious. The champagne breakfast in the morning was plentiful and offered a wonderful variety of breads, fruits, cheeses, cereals and pastries. There were even hard boiled eggs!! The grounds of the property are elegantly landscaped and well maintained and the swimming pool and hot tub were immaculate. We will definitely return to this property and highly recommend it for families or those without children.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, quiet UPGRADED Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: katehAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: I joined TripAdvisor just to write this review and thank the Napa Valley Lodge for upgrading my husband and I to the honeymoon suite. It was absolutely perfect and I really recommend going during off-season-- nice and quiet. The Bella Vista Suite had a marble and granite bathroom with a tub for two and a separate shower for two and they brought us champagne brunch each morning. The rst day, we didn't know we were VIPs with breakfast delivered :), so we went down to the main brunch area and the it was the most amazing spread of brunch I've ever seen. Book through their website for specials. It is romantic and wonderful. The other guests and Yountville seemed a bit pretentious for our tastes but it is right of Highway 29 and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Loyalty_Advisor
Reviews.Content: Working in the incentive, loyalty and travel industry I had an opportunity to visit the Napa Valley Lodge in November 2008. While beautiful, I do not believe that the value proposition for a deluxe room with a view of the vineyards was worth the price paid. The Napa Valley Lodge sits in a lovely location, but donâ€™t be up sold to the â€œroom with a viewâ€�, the view was not worth an extra $100 per night. Also, pay attention to your booking, we were promised a bottle of wine in our room to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary (combined work with pleasure), no wine. On a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being the best, I score my stay at the Napa Valley Lodge a neutral 5.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay at the lodge”
Reviews.Author: Catharina_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge in the height of the fall colors... we stayed in one of the newly remoddled rooms with a balcony overlooking the vineyards... the room was very nice... spotless, comfy and the bathroom was gorgeous! My husband especially loved the shower.... The friendly staff made our stay all the more relaxing...the continental breakfast is above and beyond the usual standard... lovely attention to detail is exhibitied throughout this lovely place. The gardens and courtyard are beautifully maintained with flowers throughout... this was a wonderful birthday gift from my husband and was such a lovely touch from the staff to find a card and bottle of wine in the room upon our arrival as well. My only regret is that we couldn't stay longer.... we will definately be back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “THE ROOMS were NOT UP TO PAR”
Reviews.Author: luxetravel
Reviews.Content: It was a strange combination of nicely done (what you see on the website photos) and hey we forgot some details here. The property is gorgeous, but our room was either the one that time forgot or not as nice as the one on the website. At that price point in the off season, you expect great bedding (not), lush towels (not even close) and newish furniture-whicker and dated ammenities was what we got. The shower had almost no water pressure. I will tell you what was gorgeous: Strangely, the bathroom was magnificently redone and spacious-loved the vanity. It was interesting that they hadn't put as much attention into the room. The grounds were immaculate and just as beautiful as the photos on the website. The complimentary breakfast was generous. And the staff was great. Overall, not worth the price we paid...

Reviews.Title: “relax in NAPA”
Reviews.Author: Gregg53
Reviews.Content: Set in Yountville, in the center of Napa valley, by a vinyard, this charming hotel is a great place to relax while experiencing Napa Valley. Rooms are quiet and inviting with in room fireplace and views of the wine country. World class restaurants are only a few minutes walk away, as are baloon rides and wine tasting rooms. This was our second stay at Napa Valley Lodge, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay both times.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Lodge - Above Average But That's It.”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: Fellow Travellers, OK - Napa Valley Lodge was stop number 4 on our recent California tour (1. Fairmont Miramar, 2. Inn of the Spanish Garden, 3. Intercontinental - The Clement) - all booked on the strength of fellow TA traveller reviews. Keep up the good work folks. Of the 5, I was least impressed with the Napa Valley Lodge, despite it's number 1 rating for Yountville. Don't get me wrong, it was perfectly acceptable (clean, great staff, good breakfast buffett included, nice pool), but it was not impressive. First of all location wise, it's right off the highway. Although the rooms are VERY soundproof, this is not what I would call a great location. There are no nice views of anything from the rooms - but you don't really come here for the views do you. The staff was wonderful, very accomodating and solicitous. For some reason they thought it was our anniversary (?), and gave us a gift of a nice bottle of red wine. The room was really nothing special, except for the bathroom which was quite elegent and spacious. The main room felt a bit like a upscale motel, although the beds were extremely comfortable. I would expect a little higher end furnishings in the main area when I'm paying $350 a night. The pool area was very nice though, and the breakfast buffet quite acceptable. Note that all the tables are seating for about 8, so you are forced to share a table with other guests for breakfast. Not a bad thing - unless your very antisocial and really just want to keep to yourself. A couple of smaller tables would not hurt. You do have the option of putting your goodies on paper plates and noshing by the pool. Not a bad way to start the morning at all. Papers are also available as you walk in. Overall I would stay here again if I had no other choice, it was quite acceptable, but seemed overpriced compared to what we got at the Inn of the Spanish Garden - which would be a good equivalent type "small" hotel. There seemed to be other hotels closer to downtown that certainly looked nicer from the outside, but I do not know what they cost or looked like inside. I would check them out for sure next time I visit Napa. Note that even Frommers (highly rated Canadian travel book series, which I normally rely on besides TA) also rated Napa Valley Lodg highly, and noted it was a "find". Given the price of the other hotels Frommers has rated in Napa, no wonder - they other places start at $500 a night and go up! Perhaps what they mean is the Lodge is a find at this price. Can't disagree with that. FINAL NOTE: We did go to the Solage Calistoga for dinner only (wonderful meal), and while it was indeed very pricey (starts at $525 and goes up), I almost regret not spending the extra $200 a night for a truly memorable experience for two nights. What we saw of the main restaurent area, pool and general grounds was quite amazing. Beautiful to say the least. TA was right on about the restaurents in the area. See my review of Redd (great). Four reviews down and one to go.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Stay Here if You are Going to Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four nights at the Napa Valley Lodge, and our stay was incredible. The property is in the absolute perfect location for amazing restaurants and any other sights or wineries you want to see while in wine country. We even wanted to play some golf while we were there and a beautiful public course is just across the highway! We did a balloon ride and wine tour, both booked through the hotel, and both companies picked us up from the lobby of the hotel, which was a great treat even though we had a car of our own. The staff was excellent and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and to make sure that we were able to book or find anything we needed. The rooms were gorgous and the bed was so comfortable. Also, everything was extremely clean, and I felt cleaner and more comfortable in my room than in many other top notch rooms that I have stayed at. The decor was so perfect, I felt like I was at home instead of in a hotel room. We had a room with fireplace overlooking the vineyard. The champagne breakfast in the morning was delicious and they even put out plastic silverware and plates and trays so that you could take breakfast out to the firepit in the chilly mornings or (as we did) back to your room. My only negative was the fitness room, but I realize most people don't care about that in wine country- four cardio machines and very few free weights is all they have. But it is a good excuse to veg out and relax! We will definitely be back...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Napa Valley Lodge is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Espejo
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is first rate. Great location, lovely, well appointed rooms, nice, heated pool and gracious staff. You are walking distance to outstanding restaurants, which is wonderful if you want to indulge in Napa Valley wines at dinner. The hotel has a large fire pit near the pool which attracts friendly people in the evening; there was always lively conversation. The breakfast buffet is generous and appetizing. Although the property is close to a main highway, there is no road noise in the rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: broachdvm
Reviews.Content: I booked the reservation online for my daughter and son-in-law's honeymoon. I have never been there, so I wasn't sure how they would like it. I left a note online to treat them with extra TLC b/c it was their honeymoon and they really did. The hotel called them ahead of time to ask if they needed any information before they came. They stayed in the Bella Vista room and said that it was like heaven. The bed was so comfy, they felt like they were floating on a cloud. Their every need was addressed quickly, they wanted for nothing. I was so happy that they could feel so pampered. One note of advise. We did have a mix up at the check out - so if you are planning on paying the tab for someone, specifically let the hotel manager know. Thanks Napa Valley Lodge for living up to your good reputation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mcconnell
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at this property. The hotel is nice but not 5 star. Property was very clean and rooms were large with a nice bathroom. Coffee maker, wet bar, robes etc. The hotel has been remodeled and they did a nice job. The pool area is a good place to relax in the afternoons. They have a "california" breakfast every morning around the pool and firepit. Breakfast was fruit, pastries, cereals, fresh juices and champagne. Nothing hot which was a disapointment. Free newspaper also. The staff was great and arranged all of our reservations at restaurants and wineries. They had good recommendations and steered us to nice places. Hotel is close to everything so it is easy to get around to everywhere. Be sure and eat at Bouchon's. This is The French Laundry's sister restaurant and was excellent and reasonably priced. It is in walking distance to hotel. The town of Napa was a waste of time. Head north to St Helena for better restaurants and stores. There are lots of free wineries that offer tastings but most of the better ones charge you a fee ranging from $10 to $50 per person for the best houses. And they were well worth the price if you like good wine. We also toured and had lunch at Round Pond Olive Vineyards where you taste olive oils. This was fun and we had a great lunch with different types of olive oils served with each item. Be sure and take some warm clothes as nights get very cool. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Just don't expect a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BradECA
Reviews.Content: Clean and updated rooms in a beautiful setting. The courtyard and pool area was nice to relax at. The included breakfast was good - fresh fruit, granola, cottage cheese, good breads, cereal, juices, etc. The hotel is close to Hwy 29, but the only time we noticed any slight traffic noise was in the courtyard sitting next to the pool. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: g_oslo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lodge for two nights and have only good things to say. Location: Immediately off the highway (but there was not a noise problem). 5 minute walk to French Laundry, 10 minutes to Boucho/Bouchon Bakery (both are great), 25 minutes to Chandon. Nicely appointed sidewalk all along. Rooms: Large, clean and well appointed. A little bit short on storage space if you travel with more than a few small bags, but otherwise very good. Carpet floors is never good, but at the lodge they seemed clean enough. Nice minibar selection. We did not try the fireplace. We did not experience any problems with our AC, as reported in a few other reviews. Other: The breakfast is good, with lots of fresh fruit. It is served in a somewhat nondescript banquet/conference room, but you can bring your food with you into the garden outside. We always find that breakfasts (this goes pretty much everywhere) lack a real high-fiber option of bread or cereals, and this goes here as well. The wifi worked well. We found the staff to be very polite, helpful and knowledgeable. Following our online reservation, the Lodge sent both e-mails and letter offering to help us out with reservations etc., and it has also sent an e-mail after our stay asking about our opinion. More hotels should do this. We would rate the Napa Valley Lodge as a good four star place offering good value for money in an area of generally high prices..

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful meeting place!”
Reviews.Author: traveloner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this wonderful lodge while attending meetings there. Our breakfast choices, meeting room, ambience, cleanliness, staff attitude, and every thing one thinks about when being far from home was impeccable. Not once in an entire week did anything go awry. Many times as I looked out a window during a meeting I saw staff cleaning bannisters, steps, windows, doorknobs, etc. outside the rooms. If I am ever in the Napa area again, the Napa Lodge will be where I stay - my comfort was number one on their list.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, but”
Reviews.Author: twoonaroadtrip
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel recently in their King Suite which was supposed to be one of their nicest (& most expensive) rooms. It was very spacious and wonderful and we truly enjoyed it except for one thing-it was July and their A/C didn't work very well, so it was very hot in the room in the late afternoon and early evening-just about the time we got back from touring and wine tasting. As the nights get cooler, we were able to sleep with the door open, but the lights from the traffic at night and the road noise in the early morning were not very conducive to getting a good night's sleep or being able to sleep in on vacation. We did contact the front desk and upon our return one day, they said that it was working fine--no difference from the day before. All in all would stay again--but not during the summer heat. We were able to go down to the pool to cool off some. Everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “amazing Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: skystk
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is a wonderful place to stay. I'm an infrequent long distance traveler but if all the lodgings were like this I would travel more frequently. The facility was very clean and well maintained. Staff always seemed to be arround and helped whenever they were asked. Next time I'm in the area I will definitely stay at the Napa Valley lodge again

Reviews.Title: “nice option in valley”
Reviews.Author: pernicketytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights last week. We were glad we picked Yountville over Napa, it is a charming town. The hotel is in a great location, you can walk to restaurants. The pool area is very pretty and well kept and clean. Our room was on the second floor with a king bed, and no view. We did not mind this as we were out the whole time, it would not have been worth the extra cost to us. The room was nice, the bathroom was very nice and large, everything was cleaned well. The only disappointment was the breakfast, we expected higher quality given the price and how nice everything else was. There was fruit salad, yogurt, bagels, toast, peanut butter and jam. I thought the pastries were supermarket quality and it would have been nice to have some cheese. In fact I would rather pay a bit more and have a hot choice as well. Due to this I would try another place next time, as we both appreciate a nicer breakfast experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to ideal as you can get”
Reviews.Author: SportsTraveler
Reviews.Content: The most impressive aspect of our experience was the help we got from the staff in their suggestions of places to visit and actually booking them for us. They even suggested/booked us into to a tour of an Olive Oil grove/processing plant. Except for Signorello, they were spot on in directing us to very memorable tours, expecially Del Dotto Caves/Winery and Swanson. The property is the perfect place to chill out. Nestled next to a vineyard and with an idea pool and hot tub area, you couldn't ask for a more relaxing place. The fire pit at is nice to sit near on those often chilly evenings. Service is attentive and genuine. If you are looking for a pool attendent taking drink orders, then this will be a disappointment for you. Just bring your own beverages to the pool and you'll be happy. Continental breakfast definitely better than average and you can eat it on the patio or by the pool. Watch out for those hungry little birds that will come and pick at your food if you leave it unattended. We will be booking there again for next July. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Napa Valley Lodge made me feel like I was in Tuscany, Italy.”
Reviews.Author: Stecz
Reviews.Content: The staff and accommodations at the Napa Valley Lodge were superb. It is a place to go for that special occasion. Well worth the extra to stay. The location is perfect. Walking distance to downtown Yountville and close to the Silverado Trail for wine tasting. A real treat. Can't wait for another special occasion----Napa Valley Lodge is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: whereisnl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel a week before July 4th weekend using our Triple A rate... averaged about $300 per night. Rooms are average-sized but well appointed. Bathroom is nice too. Our room was on the 2nd floor (there are only 2 floors), overlooking the courtyard & swimming pool, with views of the mountains in the background. Although you can see Highway 29 from the room and hear a bit of traffic, it isn't noisy or disturbing in any way. The courtyard is spacious and extremely well laid out with the pool, jacuzzi, lots of lounge chairs, patio tables too for breakfast, and a bocce ball court. The breakfast was good, with lots of pastries and fresh options -- nothing fancy but tasteful. Service was great... quietly performed but impeccable. The other nice thing about this hotel is its location... .it's at one end of the street that runs through downtown. To get to the majority of the restaurants, it's a pleasant 10-15 minute walk, which is perfect after a delicious meal. We also rented bikes from a downtown shop and biked down Salono Road which runs parallel to the 29.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: enright
Reviews.Content: This is a superb smallish hotel. We stayed here for four nights. The room was large, well appointed and the beds extremely comfortable. The bathroom is not only attractive but large and highly functional. Everything was well done--there were plenty of pillows, towels, etc. We were celebrating a birthday and we had asked the hotel staff to do several extra things. EVERYTHING was not only done, as we had requested in advance, but done well. The pool area is lovely; the grounds are impeccably maintained. ALL of the hotel staff we dealt with was very helpful, gracious and warm. We highly recommend the Napa Valley Lodge and would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamknott
Reviews.Content: I will simply confirm all the positive comments of the other reviewers and add that you don't have to worry about having a room that faces the road. Although Route 29 must be one of the busiest roads in California, we never heard the traffic when the balcony door was closed.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay in Yountville!”
Reviews.Author: GatorB-Man
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is a great place to stay if you like superior service, a clean atmosphere, a great champagne breakfast(included) and an overall great time! On top of all that, the boccie ball was a blast!! I recommend this hotel/resort to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gaz_Kent
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Lodge is great. We had a lovely large, clean room with a balcony overlooking the pool and the surrounding countryside. The service was really friendly and, best of all, there was a food and wine festival in the town when we stayed! The only let-down was the continental buffet breakfast. It was perfecty adequate, but it would've been nice to have had the choice of a cooked one. Still, that's only a minor quibble. If we ever go back there, this will be the place we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Vally Lodge: an outstanding experience!”
Reviews.Author: happyTucson_AZ
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge, although primarily for a business trip, made my husband and I feel like we were on a luxury vacation instead! The friendly, courteous staff listened and anticipated every need. Information was given in a timely manner and suggestions for ideas, places and reservations were on target. The grounds and rooms were impeccable, with the firplace adding just the right touch of cozy ambience to a perfect setting. The staff at the Lodge were stellar in their commitment to their guests. They went out of their way to accomodate our needs. An example of their help was when we asked what color the newly renovated rooms were painted because we were interested in using that color in our home, a hotel representative came with a color sample and name of the color for us to take home! Although I do miss the sauna that was there before, the newly designed outdoor area with fountains, serving areas, heated pool and jacuzzi were beautiful as well as a functional exercise room. We know we will look forward to coming back to Napa next January as long as our stay is at the Napa Valley Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying at the Napa Valley Lodge”
Reviews.Author: s4b
Reviews.Content: I am in hotels for over 100 days a year.I have stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge for eight years. It is the most consistent high quality hotels where I stay. The friendliness of the staff, the quality of the rooms, and the ambience is wonderful. I highly recommend Napa Valley Lodge to my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller604
Reviews.Content: I have travelled and stayed in many excellent hotels around the world but one I always enjoy returning to is the Napa Valley Lodge. The service received from everyone involved there is always superb -- all individuals go out of their way to make a person's stay there a memorable experience. The quiet cosy library with the fireplace off the registration area, the comfy well-appointed rooms, the pool area and hot tub, the exercise equipment, and the separate meeting building all add to to the ambience of relaxation. The building and grounds are always well maintained -- a great place to get away from it all and from which to enjoy the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Lodging Experience”
Reviews.Author: KeepOnKeepinOn
Reviews.Content: Terrific accomodations, first rate service and beautiful area. Top-knotch Front Desk staff - very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge the week before Christmas and we found it the perfect location for exploring the vineyards in Yountville, Saint Helena and Calistoga. We had a room with a fireplace, which I would highly recommend. The room itself was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom area was also very nice and the shower was wonderful - plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The only negative about the hotel was that there was a draft from the front door - and because it wasn't well-sealed, you could hear all the noise from the parking lot out front - people talking, etc. It was likely made worse due to some noisy people in the room next door. That said, you could not hear the noise in the bedroom area, so it was totally workable. A few people also commented on the fact that the hotel is near the busy main road, but this wasn't really an issue because you couldn't hear the traffic noise in the room. Additionally, many of the hotels in these areas are right off the main road, so it's hard to avoid unleass you go to one of the more expensive resorts. There are many good restaurants in this area as well - Mustard's Grill and Hurley's were two of our favorites. And the best part of our trip was a recommendation by the hotel front desk to check out the Kuleto Vineyard - it is off the beaten path, but well worth the visit - great people, beautiful grounds, perfect wine! Check out the attached pictures - ignore our mess!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the room”
Reviews.Author: winetravelDallas
Reviews.Content: This room was very nice, clean, with a terrific shower area. We had a nice view of a small vineyard in the fall with the turning leaf colors. The morning breakfast was plentiful and varied. The beds were average, but the room was clean if small. We did not have a fireplace which would have been nice on the crisp evening, but we had a small balcony. The price was a bit high, but for the area we found it to be less expensive than others that were not as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Beautiful View - Excellent Service!!! Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: pgricco
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was just wonderful. There are only 2 floors to this hotel and we stayed in a corner room with a balcony that overlooked the vineyard. The bed was very very comfortable and the room had a fireplace and a huge flat-screen TV. The bathroom was totally modern and lovely as well. The only comment I have it that while our room overlooked the vineyard, to the right is a street â€“ so I would request a room that is more central â€“ away from the street and school playground across the street. But that really was not a big deal and did not hinder our wonderful stay. The service was EXCELLENT. The staff could not do enough for us â€“ making recommendations for restaurants as well as making reservations for us. The continental breakfast was in the pool area and was very lovely â€“ we sat around the fire pit and had our morning coffee and juice. Overall â€“ one of the best hotels we ever stayed in and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND it to anyone. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Napa Valley Lodge was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Kimal
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Napa Valley Lodge had a nice patio overlooking a beautiful vineyard. My husband and I enjoyed sitting on the patio sipping a glass of wine. The Lodge was beautifully decorated, the room was large and comfortable, and the fireplace in the room was great. The complimentary breakfast each morning was very nice. The pool area was beautiful with a fire pit - very nice to sit next to on a cool night. We had dinner in Yountville one night at Redd. This restaurant was wonderful. The food was incredible. We had lunch one afternoon at Taylor's Refreshers. The burgers and fries were so good. Napa Valley was gorgeous with the leaves changing colors, and the food and wine were wonderful. The Napa Valley Lodge was the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jim027
Reviews.Content: The Lodge was absolutely terrific. It's located adjacent to a lovely vineyard. The facilities are excellent and all of the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We also enjoyed a marvelous breakfast on a patio next to the vineyard. I recommend this hotel unequivocally.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate not great”
Reviews.Author: toffeenose
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night recently. The architecture of the hotel is glorified motel. You have to walk outside thru the car park to get from the lobby to your room Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was large with generic business feel to the furnishings. We had one of the standard rooms with 2 queen size beds. Bedding was only adequate no dream bed here. Very nice high end products in the otherwise dreary bathroom. Breakfast was a continental buffet. Those who travel on business would recognise the selection bagels, croissants and few sad Danish. Not what you expect in the gourmet capital of California. The breakfast room is clearly used as a meeting room. It is dark and uncomfortable. Somehow sharing a large round table with 2 kids and their parents was not what we had in mind when we heard about the Champagne breakfast included in the room rate.. When you can eat by the pool I am sure it seems better The pool and spa were nice. As other reviewers have pointed out it is a great location for visiting the wine country but so are all the other lodgings in Yountville. Overall if you came here on a conference or got a great rate you would be satisfied but it lacks charm and ambience for a special event. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the French Laundry which was not at all disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed too....”
Reviews.Author: Rgolfnut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and well-kept; however, you can get these same attributes at a chain hotel/motel for a lot less. When I first entered my room, it felt like a well-decorated Holiday Inn room. The hotel should be commended for the photos placed on the website -- they are actual photos of areas on the property; however, take note that you will only find one room photo on the website and that did not look like my room for which I paid $345+ tax!. This is the type of hotel that will attract first-time guests, but I highly doubt that they receive a lot of repeat customers given the wide selection of accomodations in the area. So, if you are planning your first stay at this property, don't say that you were not warned! You can get better accomodations for the same price (or less) elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: OCfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here for our 5th wedding anniversary and were surprised with all the good reviews it got. For $250.00 plus per night I expected a lot more. The bathrooms are small and old. The room was decorated with weird furniture that didn't match. Our biggest complaint was the breakfast. They advertise a complinentary champagne breakfast buffet with the room. I can't belive they have gotten away with calling it a buffet for this long without every guest complaining. There was NO warm food. It was in a little room off the pool and was a medicore continental breakfast at best. There was danishes, toast, bagels, cereal, and yogurt. The same break\fast you would find at a holiday inn. There are many better choices in the area with better locations and I wish we would have chosen somewhere else for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Fine - clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-o-phobe
Reviews.Content: I booked on the basis of other recommendations and wasn't disappointed. The hotel is clean and location is very good, being just off the Silverado Trail. Yes, it is right next to the main road, but we like to sleep with the window open and still were not too bothered by the traffic (it dies off in the night, but gets busy again early morning). We were in the block further away from the road though so this might have helped. I didn't like the breakfast arrangement, which was a buffet set up in a featureless room. No staff except those to top up supplies, put your own dirty plates in a basket (not that I am incapable, just to give you an impression of what it was like!). The pool was quite small along with the seating areas - we chilled out on our own balcony which overlooked a vineyard. Yes I would go back only because of the location and proximity to good restaurants (you can walk to some).

Reviews.Title: “Nice attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: poundpod
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: Most lodgings in the Napa Valley are converted motels, built thirty or more years ago. I have stayed at the Marriott, and found it to be one of the worst of that chain. The Napa Valley Lodge is a reconditioned motel, with entrances from the parking lot, not a central lobby. It is, however, one of the most wonderfully reconditioned motels it has ever been my pleasure to stay in, bar none. The rooms are beautifully appointed, large, and plush. The bathroom in my suite, "The Sangiovese" was as nice as any major city Hyatt, Westin, or Ritz-Carlton I've seen. The staff was helpful, the room sparkling clean every day. The complimenary breakfast was fine. Not opulent, but let's face it: Who wants to eat a big breakfast when lunch in Napa and Sonoma is a culinary adventure, every single day? One bone to pick: Charging this price for rooms, and whacking the patron for internet service--and making it WebTV--is obscene. Get a real link, and make it part of the room charge. Sheesh. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Lovely pool, great location, beautiful setting. Not a bargain, but Napa in high season never will be a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Niki123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Napa Valley Lodge on our honeymoon in June. Our stay was excellent!! The room was superb -- the hotel upgraded us to the luxury suite, which had a beautiful fireplace, separate den/study, large terrace that overlooked a vineyard, huge bathroom with a two-person tub, and large separate shower. The grounds were also very nice, with a lovely pool and spa area. The location was excellent, just a couple blocks walk to some really good restaurants in Yountville, as well as a short ride to the surrounding cities. The staff was very helpful, and recommended several restaurants and day outing that we enjoyed. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great find and Great loaction!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was such a great find in napa valley! The locals even rave about htis place. Easy access to St. Helena, Rutherford, Napa and even Callistoga is a mere 15 min drive. The pool and hot tub area is right near the vineyard and the complimentary breakfast was nice. If you demand elegance, the rooms with the fireplaces are for you. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the the Napa Valley Lodge with a group of friends during a wine tasting weekend. The hotelhas a great location for exploring wineries in the region. The rooms are large and well apointed - with bathrobes (one for each of us, not just one or two!) and very nice toiletries - can't recall the brand, but they were English and smelled great. Each room has a balcony and there is a nice lloking pool, though it rained during our stay so we didn't get to use it. The staff was very helpful and the lobby is stocked with coffee, cookies and a computer in case you want to check email or search for soemthing online - a nice touch. My one complaint would be the "champagne brunch" - the food was very basic and the room it was held in was pretty dreary compared with the rest of the hotel. I'm guessing they may hold it outside when it is not raining, which would be much nicer. All in all, a very good stay.
